reviews.review:
Chose to eat at Stack last night based on Yelp reviews. I was a little skeptical because I never like to spend $50+ on an entree and was worried that I'd end up disappointed with a poorly cooked steak. I love that I was completely proven wrong.

Charlie, our waiter, was amazing. Not only did he bring us the free house shots before we even had time to check in, but he gave his honest opinion on the menu items - not the typical sales pitch to get you to spend more money. I split the Brooklyn filet with my boyfriend and we ordered 3 sides (whipped potatoes, asparagus and Mac and cheese), all of which were well prepared, flavorful and completely satisfying.

Our food came out to order, the drinks were good (not too strong) and the service was amazing. The steak here is delicious; definitely a must try restaurant while in Vegas!

And get the dessert sampler - all of the desserts are super tasty!

Came here for a fancy dinner during a bachelorette party weekend. Had reservations for 12 ppl on a Saturday.  The interior is very inviting. The wall decor is unique. I can tell a lot of money was invested.  The menu was preset, so that was good that I didn't have to think of what to order.

Shared appetizers:

 Hot rock slices of beef app was interesting. You cook thin slices of meat on this 600 degree rock.  Novelty at best.  

Tuna tartare? on a cracker was good.

Mini lamb gyros, delicious. But they brought out 8 pcs total. Uh...there are 12 of us?

Entree:

Filet mignon. It was better than your average steak, but not filet mignon status.  Had a pat of butter melting atop when served. 

Side dishes:

Although tasty, here's where it gets ugly. 1 SMALL bowl each of mashed potatoes, broccolini and green beans, and french fries.  Really? There are 12 of us at this table!  We each got like 1 tablespoon potatoes, 3 strands of green beans and/or broccolini, and a few fries.  Ridiculous.

Desserts:

Mini key lime cheesecakes.  Very good

Rasberry filled donut holes? with dipping sauce.  Also good. A plus that they were warm.

I think our bill came out to $850.  Overpriced, but an overall nice experience.  I think we would've been better off at Ruth's Chris or the like.

went for dinner last night...everything we had was delicious!   we had the "Hot Rock" appetizer...it was really good and fun to cook the meat on the rock.   For dinner we both had the filet...so tender and full of flavor...I added the jumbo shrimp and my brother had the lobster tail!   we had the boston cream pie dessert...it was one of the nightly specials....the ginger ale sorbet that came with it was awesome and like nothing I have ever had!   The meal was wonderful and the service was top notch!  Don't forget to check in on Yelp....they give you a complementary shot from the bar when you do!

As a vegan, I didn't have many options on items to eat. But the items I ordered were AMAZING! I had the brussel sprouts and a kale salad. Both were great. 

The ambiance was good, but a little too dark. It was hard to read the menu.

The stars all aligned last week over a random Monday night into Wednesday. A quick jaunt to Vegas studded with a comp room at The Orleans (because $10 Blackjack tables *cough*), tickets to the SEMA Expo and a totally random chance to meet the seller of our home and take her out to a fancy dinner. Why? Because escrow has been an absolute nightmare and she's been exceedingly patient. And for that we're grateful. And it's an excuse to baller-dine. 

I made that term up. You can use it. #BD

When boyfriend and I began discussing where we'd like to take her he gave me a side glance and said "I'm almost tempted to..." At which point I cut him off with "Go back to Stack?" 

HELL YES, GO BACK TO STACK. I furrowed my brow and scolded myself because I never reviewed Stack after our spectacular freshman visit last March. Shame, shame, Yelp Elite.

Bygones. I easily booked via Open Table and we met up with our seller on Tuesday evening for dinner. After letting us know she wasn't a seafood person, we ordered the Hot Rocks sirloin appetizer (so delicious, had it the first visit) and the short rib meatballs. Also fantastic. 

B and I split the dish that inspired our return to Stack in the first place, the Stuffed Maine Lobster, which was as mouthwatering as the first time we had it. Our seller had the Petite Filet, which looked to be perfectly med-rare, as ordered. She raved about it. 

Two sides were shared by the table, the Tater Tots and the Mac & Cheese. Both of these are good, but I feel as though they could be elevated with some culinary thought. Tater Tots with truffle dipping sauce would tip this over the edge...ketchup really falls flat. The mac and cheese, well....it's pretty standard mac and cheese. *shrug*

Service at Stack on both visits has been on point. No complaints there! The restaurant is swanky yet relaxed, romantic in a casual "Hey, I just met you and this is crazy, but here's my number, Stack, reserve a table for me, maybe"

Four solid stars. I teeter on five based on the sides. XO we'll return either way for that lobster!

Oh, and I have to give props to our little Vizsla, because when prompted to explain what about our buyer letter prompted the seller to choose our offer over an all cash investor...

Without hesitation, her reply "It was Honey." Her Huntington Dog Beach picture clinched our new home. Who woulda guessed. 

I guess I owe another steak to you-know-who with the paws. *wink*

Great meal.  Ordered the shrimp appetizer and the crab appetizer.  We also shared a burger because the prices were a little high.  Every thing was cooked to perfection and then even split the burger ahead of time for us.

The 4 star rating is for the food and service during dinner. It would have been a 5 star meal if the level pretentiousness was dialed down a bit from our server during Happy Hour and the Hostess staff.

We had a 7pm reservation but arrived at 6 for appetizers and a couple of drinks during Happy Hour at Stack.  We had the yellow tail, steak and lettuce wraps along with a couple of beers to start off with.  The Happy Hour special beer was limited to Bud / Bud Light - we went for Chimay and paid $14/glass - ouch!  The appetizers were good, the yellow tail sashimi was fantastic.  Great sauce and very good cuts of fish.  The steak on the sizzling rocks - good, but I think people may be impressed more by the presentation.  The lettuce wraps were also very good - nice blend of flavors.  The only downside was that the waitress could have cared less about paying attention to us - she was more concerned with talking with the bartender.

For dinner, we enjoyed items from the $40 Prix Fix menu - probably the best deal we could find.  This included an appetizer (all of us had the lobster tacos), a main course (steak, chicken or pasta), and dessert (either the mini doughnuts or the banana bon bon).  The food was very good - although the lobster taco appetizer was quite small, the accompanying guacamole sauce was excellent.  I had the chicken and grean beans for my main course and it was perfectly done.  Juicy and well prepared.  Our waiter was attentive, but not overbearing for dinner.

I'd recommend Stack for a very good dinner - and with the set menu that is offered, it's a good deal for Las Vegas dining!

going through the menus of the places to choose form in the Mirage was not that hard to narrow down to Stack, it seemed to have some of our favorites and from what we could tell the food was well prepared and the place had decent ratings. We had Tickets to Beatles Love that night so we made reservations for 7:30 PM and when we arrived we walked right in. 

The decor of this place is pretty cool it is very modern, the lighting is kept dark which I'm sure is in an attempt to keep the mood intimate. Now for the important stuff, the food. We were having a date night so we went a little above the normal, we started off with the lobster taco appetizer ($21) this was delicious but definitely small, for our entree we ordered the surf and turf for 2 ($159) which was Huge and super delicious it came with 42oz of prime meat and a 2lb stuffed lobster that was stuffed with King crab and a Ritz cracker mixture, all I can say is wow.. The two sides ordered where the Adult tater tots which are an experience all in itself and then the ultimate let down that was ordered was the baked mac and cheese. Unlike most other steakhouses in Vegas that normally have a Truffle mac and cheese this was just very plain and dry and seemed like they really just threw some noodles in a dish and sprinkled some cheese on top and threw it in the oven. We also ordered the banana cream pie bites for dessert, those I have to add were absolutely amazing. With all of this our dinner ended up running about $300 and the question was, " was it worth it?" I would say yes in this case. 

The servers had a great handle on everything, our drinks never went empty, All of the questions we had were answered and I not one time got that overwhelming pretentious feel you sometimes get at some of the high end steakhouses here in town. Will I go back? Sure, would I do anything different? Yes, I would go for a seafood stack appetizer and stay away from the small bites appetizers since they definitely pay the bills with those.

My friend wanted to try this spot for a bachelorette party. We made reservations WELL in advance. Once we checked in with the hostesses - they were rude and unwelcoming. Even after having a reservation, we were told that the wait would be 30 minutes. Having a reservation for over a month at this spot, our table should be ready when we check in. Typically 30 minutes isn't a long time and I would bite my tongue and just wait, but we had 10 girls and plans immediately after. One of my girlfriends went up to the hostesses about 15 minutes after we were told to wait (I have no idea what she said, but we were seated very quickly after that) 

My friend made a reservation they gave us the option of having a prefix menu because it's easier for a large group. We didn't want the prefix menu so we chose to order what we wanted at a $40 minimum. She even had to sign a ridiculous contract in order to set this reservation. Once we were seated, the waiter gave us the prefix menu and we told him that we had prior reservations for ordering anything on the menu but having a $40 minimum per person. The waiter was EXTREMELY rude and pretty much didn't want to serve us (probably because the prefix menu is an easy tip for him - lazy)

BESIDES the fact that their entire staff is incompetent and lazy, the food was actually pretty good. 

-Me and my friend decided to split the seafood tower (the middle tier that was 80$) and it came with 2 lobster tails, 4 huge shrimps, 3 pieces of crab leg, and 8 oysters. 
-The tater tots were really good as well although I don't think I would ever spend $11 bucks on these again. I mean... they're tater tots. 
-I tried a piece of my friends Tomahawk bone in rib eye and THAT WAS AMAZING. It was huge too. I wish I would have ordered this

The drinks were average. The bartender made us "special shots" (that probably had spit in them) but they were called "white gummy bears." (it's pretty much raspberry vodka with peach schnapps and sprite) nothing special or amazing. 

The two stars is for the food. Everything else gets zero stars - sorry stack - you shouldn't have customers jump through ridiculous hoops to make a reservation.

This place is ammaaazzzeeballllss! I had the bone in filet mignon, to DIE for! The mac & cheese, pigs in blanket, Ahi and their beautiful beverages! Not a bad thing about this place for me, simply amazing. And the dessert! Oh my.. try the raspberry filled donuts, you will melt. highly recommend this place.

I went here with some HS friends on a Saturday night. It was around 7:30pm and it wasn't busy at all! But it got busy around 8:30pm. I guess the party tends to follow us. =P

They don't call this place STACKS for nothing. Upon arriving, the host/greeter was "stacked" if you know what I mean. *wink wink*. All the guys in my group couldn't stop staring at the girl. 

In any case, some of us ordered steak, some of us ordered a burger. We also got adult tater tots that were pretty good. The steak was pretty good too.  I found the french fries to be quite salty and somewhat spicy.  The food was good but I didn't think it was the best I've ever had. 

The service was very good though. Very dim atmospherebut in a good, cool, and romantic type of way.

For me, the best thing I had that night was the Cherry Creme Brulee! YUUUUUMMMMMY!!! It was so delicious!!
Dinner was awesome! Our server was exceptional especially dealing with the large group of 12!  Everything I ate was delicious (& I am a picky).

we were staying at Mirage and going to see a 7 pm Cirque show, so we decided to dine close and wanted to eat early. Stack opens at 5 pm, so we skipped lunch and made a 5 pm reservation via Yelp - super easy. We were seated immediately and all staff were very nice and attentive. The ambiance is chill, there was good music playing but not so loud you couldn't talk, and I kept reminding myself we were in the heart of a Vegas casino....  

we ordered cocktails, the seafood platter as a starter (excellent), split a Caesar salad (good), and one entree of sea bass over lobster risotto (excellent), and one petite filet (cooked perfectly, and one of the best I've had in ages), with a side of asparagus. and a nice bottle of Malbec.  everything we ordered was cooked perfectly, and we were actually surprised at the quality of the food. The menu is on the pricey side, but so was everything else in Vegas, so we got over that early and enjoyed the excellent dinner and service.

I visited Stack as part of a 10 person party during a recent vacation in Vegas. We went late, after the early showing of "Love" (highly, highly recommended, BTW). They got off to a good start when a request for an extra spicy bloody mary with no celery delivered in solid fashion. Then, we had appetizers for the table:

Hot rock beef: Quite nice, thinly sliced and great with a cooking time of, oh, about 1.5 seconds per side :) 
Yellowtail sashimi: Fresh taste but not up to par with a top sushi restaurant. 
Chili cheese fries: An upscale twist on an everyday dish. The chili was fantastic; a bowl of it would make a great meal. 
Adult tater tots: Very large tots stuffed with bleu cheese (I believe); very, very tasty and generous portion. A little shy on cheese, though, as someone else noted. 
Lobster tacos: Tasty and full of tender lobster, but a but small. 
Pigs in a blanket: Interesting shape, but not otherwise remarkable

For my entree, I chose the bone-out sirloin, medium rare. It was cooked to perfection, very flavorful and juicy. A definite winner. My wife and step-daughter had the surf and turf which looked small on the plate, but was huge on taste and tummy-filling satisfaction. 

Finally, the jelly filled donut holes for dessert were plentiful and heavenly in taste and texture. 

Since nobody in our party drank more than one drink and we shared a lot, we just split the bill ten ways. The total per person, including tip and tax, was $90. I commented at the time that a similar meal back in Dallas, outside of the luxury hotel markup, would have probably cost $75-80, so not a bad premium. 

Please be advised that I'm pretty stingy on the five star ratings; this particular restaurant missed it because of some of the appetizers, limited menu and lack of an absolutely killer entree among the ones we ordered.

We just came back from a great experience from the Cattle Company.  You are wondering what does this have to do with Stack?

Stack should take some lessons in customer service from them.  For a steakhouse that positions itself as high end, their customer service is zero stars.  If you are going to spend close to $100 per person for a meal here, your expectations are high.

First problem: the restaurant wasn't busy at all and the waiters would be talking with each other about the NBA finals, which club they went to last night, etc.  During this time, I finished my steak and was waiting for someone to take my plate.  After waiting, I had to flag someone down before.

Second problem: when I left, the hostesses were talking with each other when I walked by, totally ignoring me like I was invisible.

BTW, the steak was great, but the bad customer service experience tainted the whole meal.
The salmon was without a doubt the worst I have ever had!! The spinach has way to much salt. The only positive I can say is they Eagle Rare bourbon.

The duck breast dish was delicious, but the rib eye steak was so 9 salty it tasted like ocean water. Not worth the price, but I'd money is no object definitely go for the duck and not the steak unless your blood is full of salt already.

This was The Disaster of a recent working weekend in Vegas. Accompanied by the star of a popular television series, we first ordered appetizers: meat that we cooked on a rock (very good), Oysters Rockefeller (good), then it all went to hell. After waiting an extraordinarily long time for our entrees - and the place was not very busy - we were served revoltingly tepid steak and cold "high-end" tater tots. We sent the tots back for replacement but decided to soldier on with the meat due to the passage of time. The tots never came back. We were given a bill that included the cost of the tots. We paid for everything and left in disgust. Horrible.

Just got back from Vegas after staying at the Mirage with a group of friends, and had dinner at Stack while there. None of us will be going back to this restaurant!

Stay away from this place! Menu was completely random (assume some stoned prep cooks put it together late one night after their shift), with very little selection and mediocre quality in food.

Also, the service here SUCKED! The waiter was completely baffled how to split up our bill, and actually wanted to argue with one of us over a side dish. Really?! We visit LV regularly, and there are sooo many more restaurants to get a great meal, great service, and enjoy your time in Vegas.

Net: we only came in for drinks and a few light bites before heading to Love. We ordered enough food (three apps) to get a sense of this portion of the menu but can't speak for the full dinner experience.

There are five of us here in Vegas for the weekend - two couples and an exchange student (high school). We had tickets for Love and needed a place to grab a quick bite before the show. We had dinner reservations elsewhere after the show. We jut needed a quick something to tide us over.

When we arrived the first thing we noticed was that the hostess was kind of a bitch. Despite that fact we stuck around since it was close to the theater. It's also a beautiful space. We ordered drinks (a diet with lemon, glass of wine and two extra dirty martinis, straight up, with blue cheese stuffed olives) and three apps (yellowtail sashimi, hot rocks, pigs in blankets*). The drinks took a while to arrive but the martinis were well-worth the wait. Wow. With the extra time it took to bring the drinks one would think the lemon would have arrived with them but no such luck. The waitress remembered when handing them out and said, "lemon" but still had to be reminded when the food came. Eh.

The sashimi brought in decent reviews from the fish eaters in our crowd. The presentation was beautiful but the portion was a little small - perfect for two or three, though. Keep that in mind if going in for snacks. The hot rocks are pure kitsch but seriously lack flavor. This may be because we got it gluten free so it was missing soy sauce but even so, steakums on a rock? Eh. The aforementioned, difficult to pluralize pigs in blankets were really good.

Service was spotty, all the waitresses look exactly the same and if the attitude is part of the vibe Stack is going for they should reconsider. I don't need my waitress to be my friend but she should smile once in a while and check in. For a quick bite it'll do but my next trip to the Mirage will include trying another place. 

-----
*Anyone know the proper way to pluralize this?

Where do I begin with this place.... Let's start with the apps we had! Hot Rocks, Crispy Rock Shrimp, Mini Lamb Gyros... oh and the cocktails!

For an entree, I got the Seabass as I was already feeling full from all the apps! Everyone else got a juicy steak and said it melted in their mouths. 

We had a full wait staff helping us. There was one guy taking our food orders and another fulfilling our alcohol needs.

Bottom line, you can't order a bad meal here and you won't leave hungry. Wouldn't recommend this place to vegetarians...

This restaurant is a hidden gem inside mirage hotel and casino. There is a bar like vibe, so as soon as you walk in you'd expect it to be more like a bar than a restaurant.

Upon being seated, you will have like 2-4 waiters constantly checking up on you. 

i ordered the tomahawk steak. it was around $60. Might I say, this was one of the most juciest and tender steaks ive ever had ~ it melts in your mouth. expensive though. 

The appetizers weren't that good. I tried the baked mac and cheese. Did not like it.

Dining at the Mirage before our show proved to be one of the best ideas we had all week.  After going to quite a few steakhouses on the strip, this one may be one of my favorites.  Decent beer selection, cool flowy wood decor, dark and candlelit interior, awesome food, and nice presentation too (if you care about that stuff).  We ended up getting a Caesar Salad (Good...I especially liked the fresh ground pepper that gets whipped out of the special belts that the servers wear.  Ha.), the Bone-Out Petite Filet (Juicy and delicious!), and the Colorado Lamb Rack (OHMYGODHEAVENLY.  I don't know what was in that red wine jus but I was sopping up EVERY LAST DROP of it.).  For sides we also added on some Whipped Potatoes (Yes, they ARE actually better than Mom's.  Sorry, Mom.) and the Crunchy Steak House Fries (Nice and crispy with parmesan shreds sprinkled and baked on and a good mayo dipping sauce.  Only wish there was more truffle oil on these.).  

I will definitely be back...although I will skip the stupid Beatles' Cirque afterwards...but that's another story.

Stack is high priced with a promising ambience.  But very quickly we realized that this place is not what it bills itself as (that is fine dining in a posh setting).  

We had 2 waiters, one fellow was very amicable, the other was obviously out of his element.  I had a NY sirloin which was tough.  The drunken diners created a very loud atmosphere, and one girl was puking in the bathroom.  Also, bussers tried relentlessly to clear our plates while we were eating.  It was clear that the philosophy was get em in get em out and ring for all their worth.

Total bust.  $100/plate I will never get back.
Food was EXCELLENT!!!  The atmosphere was great, employees were all friendly, and the hot rock appetizer was awesome!!  A must go on the strip!!!

My husband and I came to the Mirage on our honeymoon, and decided to eat at Stack before hitting up a Cirque show. The hostess asked if we were celebrating any special occasion, which I tought was nice. The server came over with a Champagne toast and one of the on site photographers came and got a couple nice shots of us. And probably one of the best steaks I've had in a long time!The food is extremely high priced, but worth it if you're willing to spend the extra dough. After all, it IS Vegas so why not?!

Came here to bid our girlfriend adieu as she ventures off into married land. I wasn't sure what to expect, but I liked Stack a lot. I would definitely come back. To be fair, I should warn you that the prices are a bit on the steep side. But, it's Vegas isn't it? Of COURSE you're gonna spend some cash while you're here! The staff was great (minus the hostesses who appeared to have a slight stick up their ass), but the servers were awesome. The manager was nice too, checking to see how we were doing. Definitely recommend the "hot rocks" (kobe beef that you cook yourself on these steamed stones)....MMMM it practically melted in my mouth. The seabass was tasty with it's shellfish broth and lobster risotto. I'd definitely recommend paying a visit to Stack the next time you're in Sin City.

The food here is excellent! For two of us to share, we ordered the Adult Tater Tots (try these without the ketchup...they don't need it and taste best on their own); Short Rib Meatballs (great balls of goodness! The sauce was deeeeeelicious!); and Big Chopped Caesar Salad (also yummy, especially because we were craving lettuce after a day or two of margaritas and G&Ts).

Stacks goes on my list of "wins" for LV restaurants.

We were at the Mirage for the Tosh show and I was just looking for a place to eat at the resort. Stack was awesome, amazing food, good service, although a little confusion with three different waiters. The ambiance would have been great except for the electronic music that was too loud (maybe turn it down to six from eight), overall a great experience.

Amazing restaurant and great environment. The service was incredible. Came here on a bachelorette party and had the pre set menu. The servers took great care of us. Kyle, one of the servers was excellent. I highly recommend it.

Most people swear by steak houses as a destination. Despite a flooded steak market, it was a pleasure to eat here. Great martini despite my ridiculous instructions. Protein temperatures were on point. Service was definitely professional and refined. My guest and I went through all the courses, from tartar to caffeine; the process was thoroughly enjoyable.

This restaurant is getting 3 stars because the food was great but the service was HORRIBLE. Our server Manny I believe his name was took forever to come take our orders, we first ordered a bottle of champagne and he only brought one glass and there was 7 of us he then proceeded to bring 2 champagne glass at a time. I know he could have fit at least 5 in his hand. My friend had ordered her steak medium well and they brought it out medium rare. My friends had told the host and server multiple times that it was my birthday and if I could get a desert, they forgot to bring the desert so when we asked for a 3rd time we waited for 15 minutes and I finally gave up on the desert and left. It's ok for the food but for the prices you could get better service somewhere else in vegas.

Had dinner here 12/25/2016, on our first night in town. Made reservations ahead of time and had been looking forward to giving this place a try. Hubby ordered the 14 oz. Brooklyn Filet with Crispy Brussel Sprouts and I ordered the Risotto.

My Risotto was pretty damn good, lots of flavor and nice and creamy. Got to sample some of my hubby's steak and it was amazing, cooked perfectly and even though I tried the sauces they brought with it, didn't even need it. Brussel sprouts we're very good and I'm definitely going to try to cook them the way they do next time I make them at home, thanks to Juan for letting me know how . 

Didn't try any of the appetizers, glad we didn't because we were pretty full just with our entrees. Hubby had the Long Island and I ordered their Moscato D'asti both were pretty good. Service was good and our server was very informative and helpful. We'd definitely give this place another try.

If you have been to FIX then you have been to STACK . Same culinary style and decor. The food is good here it's just that I think they put more emphasis on their image as a social venue. I want to dine in a restaurant not hang out.

I live in San Francisco and even I think this place is overpriced!  I understand Vegas is moving up in their culinary reputation but seriously Stack, this is uncalled for.  I went to dinner here right before seeing the Beatles' LOVE show (which I will review later) and managed to get seated sans a reservation on a busy Saturday night (I was here for CES but the Adult Entertainment Conference was also in town).  

First impressions are very big to me when it comes to my first dining experience and so I was glad to be greeted by some smokin' hot waitresses.  Usually a sign of something exciting, though sometimes a sign that they're trying to compensate for something.  But I'm all about giving restaurants the benefit of the doubt.

The ambiance is super trendy, which also equals very loud!  I felt like I was in a club!  Not to mention, it was so dark in there I could hardly read the menus and you get seated so close to the table next to you, it's almost a requirement that you make new friends.  

The food was alright but according to my price-to-tastiness ratio, this place gets a C.   I had the house special risotto with black truffles which was actually an appetizer but came in an itty bitty bowl - very simple but way too greasy for my taste.  My coworker had a few of their American style appetizers (tater tots, etc) which were, not surprisingly, mediocre.  The service, on the other hand, was excellent - everything I'd expect from a nice restaurant - the waiters were very attentive without making us feel rushed, the napkins were always folded when we left, and the bathroom attendant was adorably nice!  Even though I didn't pay, the price-to-tastiness ratio weighs heavily on my stars and stacked up to the rest, three stars is all I can give you.

I came here for a company dinner for 10 and it was great! The only down side was that there wasn't a solid selection of vegetarian items, even though they had one or two entree's and the waiter helped out in selecting items for us he could make veggie which was great.  Granted I didn't expect a vase selection of vegetarian items but overall still great place to go and enjoy! Thanks for a good time!

When we walked in the music was thumping. I hoped it would stop as we left the bar area. Nope. I had to lean in across the table to hear my friends wife speak. Then our two seat table wobbled so bad the young man was folding a napkin in half to put under the base. The lobster was one of the best I've ever had. Great display. The steak was good but not great. I don't mind spending money but $19 for a cocktail is rediculous. With all the choices in Vegas I don't go back.

I went here last week with a group of girls for a bachelorette party -- we did a prix frixe menu.  The appetizers were all fantastic (lobster tacos, black cod lettuce wraps, & the hot stone sirloin were our favorite).  You have to get the jelly donuts for dessert, they are delish.
Great service and great food. Will definitely be back when in Vegas. Worth every dime!

I had the Kobe beef burger.  Very good and tasty.  Perhaps the best burger I had in a while.  Wife had the brooklyn fliet w/bone that was well made that came with two sauces.   

As expected, this steakhouse is expensive, like most Vegas places but I left feeling ripped off.   Side dishes are extra on top of a $46 steak.  They serve you no bread while you wait.  The food was good but we only got two dishes and one drink and it was over $100.  If it wern't for that I'd give this place 4, maybe 5 stars.  I digg the atmosphere they created and the music is loud if that bothers you.  I probably won't come back until they at least add one sidedish included with your dinner and some dinner bread.

I've stayed @ Mirage many times and this is the first time trying Stack. And a big thanks to their neighbor, Japonais for telling me we needed to make a reservation to eat, and the earliest was @  9:00, 2 hours later. There was a hungry 10-year old with us. So I called the concierge and got a reservation right away @ Stack. Got the $59 fixed price deal and it was AWESOME! The hot rock was great, my filet was cooked to perfection and the dessert platter was a fine ending. Great staff. And I think the "Stepford" comment is odd cuz the girls were friendly and professional. Maybe the fact that they were all beautiful girls was why.

So I was flipping channels one day, and it landed on the KARDASHIANS.  Oh my.  OK, so curiosity got the best of me and I let the TV linger on them for a minute...yes, it was a Vegas episode and yes they were at the Mirage and YES they went to One Oak.  AND THEN I SAW THEM EATING AT STACK.  I said, "Gee, I've been there!  THANK GOD I DIDN'T BUMP INTO THEM!!"  So that prompted me to finish the review.

IMHO, Stack has the best atmosphere of the Mirage restaurants.  The service was good.  We sat on two different evenings in the bar area, which gives a wonderful view of the diners, the casino, and the bar itself.  Beautiful, hot staff lol.  But you can't eat them.  So onto the food:

My favorites were the mains:  Sea Bass on lobster risoto with a sublime broth, and a salmon w/rock shrimp etoufee and spinach.  Had both.  Loved them.  For starters I liked the tuna tartar with my Riesling.  And the house Riesling is AWESOME.

I was less enamored with the Oysters Rockefeller and Lobster Rolls.  And other apps that we had, well...I just can't recall them anymore.  Look, if you're at the Mirage, you could do worse.  And you could also pay more.  I WOULD GO BACK.  AND I WOULD REPEAT THE ABOVE.
I had a very poor experience here. The service was slow and inattentive (this includes the bar). The food was incredibly average and incredibly expensive.

I don't even know where to start on this review. This was probably the best meal I have ever had in the last 10 years. Hands down. To start, the menu has a great selection of appetizers, courses, and sides that are easy to mix and match. 

Appetizers:

Hot Rock: Thinly sliced layers of beef that you cook on a 600 degree rock. We actually ordered a second round, because the beef literally melts in your mouth. The rock also adds an element of danger, which we found quite exciting.

Yellowtail Crunch: I'm not a raw fish person at all, and I loved this. 

Rock Shrimp: Not my favorite dish of the night, but the thai chili sauce was fantastic.

Dinner:

Garbage Salad: For my gluten free friend, we ordered the garbage salad. You could tell a lot of love went into this salad. Everything was chopped up and mixed to perfection. I was eyeing the hearts of palm and blue cheese crumbles.

2 lb Maine Lobster: Yes, this was definitely my order. This could have been my last meal on earth and I would have been happy. The lobster was stuffed with a ritz cracker stuffing and had fresh drawn butter. I might even cry just remembering that part of the meal.

Side Dishes:

Adult Tator Tats: The cutest presentation. It came on one of those petite cast iron dishes with a mason type jar of ketchup. The tots were filled with bacon and brie. Amazing.

Whipped Potatoes & Baked Mac & Cheese: The Mac and Cheese won this round. I would go back to Stack just for the Mac & Cheese. It had smoked ham, peas, and a crunchy topping. Adult junk food at its finest.

Dessert:

We were so full at this point, but I refused to leave without trying something, so we settled on the Banana Cream Pies with malted chocolate ice cream. Everything tasted homemade, and it rivaled even my favorite banana pudding at Magnolia's in New York. I wish we could have tried the jelly doughnuts or molten chocolate cake, but that gives us a good reason to go back.

What great spot! 

The good thing was is we a variety of people in our group and everyone got what they wanted!

I had the filet cooked medium rare. It was delicious. They amount of sides that we shares just put our bellies over the top.

The appetizers are a great way to start the meal. You can get a couple different ones and make it a meal.

All this food was great! I washed it down with a martini. Stack had many different drink selections.

The donuts for dessert!!

I recommend you go to Stack. A fun and upbeat restaurant!!!

Great room and ambiance, attentive and friendly service, nice use of technology with the iPad drinks menu. Food was good: lobster roll app was delicious, kuushi oysters were as fresh as if we were on the coast, and salmon entree was perfectly cooked. The étouffée sauce with the lobster was really amazing and reminded me of New Orleans. Chicken entree was just ok, a little dry but overall good. Sit in the back so you don't have to look at the casino floor--makes you feel away from the bustle.

First of all, I absolutely love how you place your order on the touch screen section to the right when you walk in. I like the little things lol! I guess since it's different, I like it. The whole menu has pictures, which I like too. Once you place your order, you pay at the register then find a seat. The restaurant is open and overlooks the casino. There's a little bar section, tables and half booths. 

My friends and I had dinner here. I ordered a piece of pepperoni pizza and it was delicious! It's a large, New York style piece of pizza. The pizza and a bottle of water were around $12. My friends ordered nachos, pizza and a salad. Everything looked really good. I saw a lot of people ordering burgers and they looked yummy too. 

I think this is a good affordable option in the Bellagio, if you want a quick meal. I mean...it's not cheap but hey it's the strip! I'm definitely going to go back because there are a couple more things on the menu that looked good!

I was pleasantly surprised by Stack.

Seafood tower was very fresh. After all, it's the middle of the desert.

Tacos very good. Only thing that didn't blow me away was hot rock beef. It was tasty, but I think it's more of a novelty.

Great steak (fillet).  All sides, including mac and cheese, asparagus, mushrooms, and potato gratin were better than anticipated. Particularly liked the scalloped potatoes (gratin), but shrooms great - not overseasoned - just delicious. Nothing over, or under salted. Everything was really balanced and well prepared.

I was really impressed.

Stack is getting four stars for really one reason alone- hot rocks. Man I think about that dish ALL the time. When Hot Rocks arrives at your table, it's uncooked. You're presented with a rectangular tapas plate that houses a 9" inch über-thin slab of sirloin marinating in oils along with a hot plate carrying a softball-size sizzling black rock. Guess what happens next? You throw that beautifully cut sirloin right on top of that rock for no more than 30 seconds and enjoy! Wow, wow wow! Just so tasty.
Prices are a little steep here, but I will most likely be back next time I'm in town.

My sister and I stopped by the bar on a Sunday night to get some drinks and appetizers before our show. The bar had a very cool atmosphere, large and open, but the seating was arranged in a way to make it feel more intimate.  The lighting was great, and the music volume was perfect (maybe we got the more subdued Sunday evening mix).  We ordered the Yellowtail Sashimi and Ahi Tartar--both were delicious--clean and fresh.  My sister ordered a pear cocktail, which was quite good (though a little sweet for my taste), and the pour on my Lagavulin was generous.  Wait staff were professional and friendly. Yes, it's a bit pricey, but we went in knowing that and both felt it was the perfect meal before our show.

Food was amazing.  My husband waned a good ribeye and I wanted filet.  He ordered the tomahawk and I the 8oz.  They were both cooked perfectly.  We also had the adult tater tots and the jelly donuts.

Don't leave without trying the jelly donuts!!!

Very frustrated!

I was run into by a waiter not watching where he was going. This was after someone taking our table as we were being escorted by the hostess to the table. Then we were scolded by a waitress who was concerned we were left standing in the dinning room. 

Wouldn't you know it, the waitress who scolded us ended up being our waitress.  You just can't make this stuff up.  Then the waitress knocks over a water glass at our table almost wrecking my cell phone which was on the table. Whew. It ended up being ok. Then our table awash in water started draining into my lap. 

Next our waitress almost forgot to take my order. Thankfully my wife stopped her and let her know she hadn't taken my order. No apology. Just a simple "Oh I thought I had already taken your order."

Help me understand.  Isn't my experience supposed to be better than this?

I ordered the bone in New York strip and it was very welled prepared.  I've had better but I've certainly had worse. I would rate the steak average for a higher end restaurant. The adult tater tots were spot on for me. 

Overall I thought the food was solid. My waitress was best described by my party as better suited for a dinner. A big disappoint me for me since I was expecting to be treated very well and simply wasn't.  I recommend you go somewhere else for simple fare well prepared. Service needs to improve. 

So over all food was solid as I would expect for the price.

Here's the deal, if you're going to be a premium Vegas restaurant and charge these prices, you better deliver.

Had a business meal here with 10 total guests, and encountered several issues. Our waiter was initially prompt and pleasant, although as the night went on he seemed to disappear. After ordering or first round of cocktails we had to wait over 15 minutes, which is completely unacceptable.

Appetizers were decent although barely should be considered shareable as most cost $15-20 and were enough for maybe 2 people.

And dinner, the consensus was the steaks were all pretty standard, nothing to right home about. Of course I was the only one who's meal was "forgotten." The entire table was served and nothing for me. It became clear that they forgot to enter my meal into the system and had to rush it out. This means I was eating once everyone was done.

Even better, I ordered the lobster GREEN curry which was decidedly orange and not a green curry. I've had enough curries over the years to realize this was something completely different.

We skipped dessert but after dinner was served our main waiter was nowhere to be found. They didn't comp my meal and a a manager never stopped over. 

For an evening of $150 meals per person, spend your money elsewhere.

the front desk girls nearly made me turn away from this place.  no smiles.  looked bored and annoyed.  the place was nearly empty and they asked that we stand to the side while they find us a table.  seriously?!  

but once we were seated the tone changed.  the waitstaff was really friendly and very knowledgeable.  we had fun using the ipad to look up a bottle of wine to share and enjoyed looking at the beautiful dining area.  we asked who the architect was and the waiter said he couldn't remember but he went and found out for us which was really cool.

we decided to get a bunch of small things instead of a meal.  the adult tater tots are amazing.  I suggest getting 2 orders.  the cheese is melty and amazing and the bacon flavor is strong and lovely.  the lobster rolls were a total disappointment.  the toasted bread was a waste and the lobster was small and uninteresting flavor.  the tuna tartare was a huge portion on a bed of avocado - I could have eaten the entire thing - insanely good!  and the rock shrimp were very good also.

Came for a bachelor party 10 people strong. The hostess was very nice in accommodating our reservation and we were sat immediately. The free house shot was nice (check in with Yelp for free booze? Yup!) The wait staff is very friendly and patient. I ordered the Alaskan Salmon and it was wonderful. I had a pleasant time and recommend this restaurant if you want to treat yourself or friends to good food.

Wow!  The food here was delicious!!  We started with a caesar salad which we split and was plenty as a starter.  The hubs had the 14oz Brooklyn filet with two house made sauces.  Very good!  I had the braised short ribs.  Oh...my...gawd!!!  The meat melted in my mouth.  The seasoning was perfect.  I would probably say one of my favorite meats ever.  I will be coming back for that delightful morsel of heaven. We shared the mashed potatoes - so creamy and velvety.  The mac and cheese was a perfect combo of shells, the right amount of cheese and hints of bacon.  Everything was perfectly seasoned and we left quite satisfied.  We had non-alcoholic beverages and skipped dessert.  Bill with tip was $185.  We will definitely be back!!

The mashed potatoes are to die for. Seriously. I've never had mashed potatoes so good!! Even if you go for dinner and drinks, make sure you get the potatoes as a side. I can't stress this enough!! Service is fantastic too.

I have eaten here at least 20 times. Never, did I find it necessary to order an entree.
The appetizers are the only way to eat here. Get your favorite six people, plop down over fun apps like chicken wings, mini Kobe chili cheese dogs, mini pigs in a blanket and mini crab cakes. If you are intent on ordering an entree, order the pasta with peas and ham. It is SO  yummy!!! Truffle cream sauce is always good right?
Leave room for dessert, because you will have to order two. There is no exceptions people. 
Go to Stack and go often!!! The Light Group has done it right!!!

I loved this restaurant!  I came here with 6 of my girlfriends for a bachelorette party.  The restaurant is in the Mirage, which I have always loved, but the restaurant itself is superb.  It was clean, spacious and airy.  It had people in it, but it was not too packed (we came on a Sunday night).  The food was delicious (I orders the petit fillet Mignon with sides of spinach and a baked potato & for dessert we had these yummy little raspberry filled donuts with this creamy dipping sauce), and the service was outstanding.  I have to say a big "thank you" to Doug, the manager, who was so helpful.  He told us about the club to go to on a Sunday night, and he even managed to call a friend and get us put on the guest list so that we did not have to stand in line.  We so appreciated the nice treatment in a town where if you do not pay $600 for bottle service at a club, they do not want to know you.  Overall, the food, ambiance and service of Stacks was topnotch!

Did a prix-fix menu with my group and here's a quick review:

Appetizer (these aren't the exact names):

Lobster taco: so-so
Cod lettuce wrap: a little fishy
Stone beef (thin slices of beef cooked on a hot stone): good
Hamachi: decent
Sausage in a blanket: good but oily

Entree:
Filet Mignon: ordered medium and it was good and tender.
Served with a peppercorn and some kind of wine sauce. I used the wine one.

Side:
Fries: has a kick but too salty
Veggies: too salty

Dessert:

Mini key lime pies: good
Mini blueberry cheesecake: good

Overall: 3.5

Got a quick seat at the bar.  The bartender was awesome, great service and poured good drinks. The service was super fast.   However, We both had 8oz filet MR and the size was good but there was little flavor.  The mushrooms were awful.  Have had much better comparable at Ruth's Chris. For two people at $230 would go somewhere different if I were you.

I would have given it 5 stars, but the "little" hostesses weren't very pleasant.They were mindless and without personalities. However, our server was great! We got the Triple D package for 2. It was a great price and the food was amazing. The hot rocks appetizer was so good and fun to do. I enjoyed everything from the sweet corn soup to that "Slap yo mama" good pasta. I wanted to take the pasta home with me, it was THAT good. I would recommend this place when your in Vegas. It has a sexy vibe. It is a little noisey, but the music was good, so I didn't mind.

Food - Good. I ate the $45 price fixe menu. The lobster tacos were great, the steak was good and the dessert (some kind of mint chocolate concoction) was delicious (best part of the meal)
Service - Okay. We had to wait 10 minutes before we got seated even though we had a reservation
Price - On the pricey side (2 ppl food + bottle of wine will be $100ish)

This was our second time here.  We were pretty disappointed again. My husband ordered the lamb and it was over cooked and very tough to cut through and when he did get a chunk of meat off the bone he almost choked on a tiny thin little bone about 2" long, so he ended up just sending his entire dinner back. I had the sea bass (which is one of my favorite meals I order every where we go) and it was pretty dry.

No complaints on the appetizers and the service was okay. I'm just not sure I would really recommend this restaurant.

Stack is one of the most beautiful restaurants in Las Vegas, and most definitely the best steakhouse in town. I dined here for my mother's birthday and had the best experience from the moment we walked in to the moment we walked out. The restaurant itself is gorgeous with luxurious African mahogany tables and wooden pannels tiered in a way that reminds me of the Antelope Canyon in Arizona. The lighting is dim and the music was up beat creating a fun yet intimate atmosphere. 
             To start off, the ladies at the door were very friendly and welcoming. Before we had time to approach the host stand we were already greeted with smiles. We were sat right away without waiting and the hostess wished my mom a Happy Birthday which was a very nice gesture that made her happy.
        Our servers, Zach and Manny were very attentive and had menus ready to go for us as soon as we sat down. My mother was unable to eat meat that night so she ordered the Seabass that comes with a delicious Lobster Risotto that literally melts in your mouth. Being a steak lover I ordered the Petite Filet with a side of Truffle Mashed Potatoes that have a unique taste unlike the regular mashed potatoes. For appetizers we shared the infamous Hot Rocks which are thin slices of sirloin beef in a spicy zesty ponzu sauce. Not only were they delicious but it was also fun to get to fry the meat on a hot rock at the table. My mother and I also ordered the Pigs in a Blanket and the Yellowtail Sashimi; they were equally delicious as everything else. Zach, our server made suggestions for our wines and we did not regret it. Since my mother had the Seabass a cold glass of Sauvignon Blanc was a perfect wine to top it off and I had the Prisoner red blend that went perfect with my steak. 
           The manager sent out a dessert for us that said Happy Birthday on the plate. That was very kind of him and made my mother very happy! It was a delicious Warm Chocholate Cake with a scoop of ice cream. It was the perfect size because after such a heavenly dinner we barely had room for anything else. 
           Overall experience was one of the best I've had as a diner. Everyone was attentive, approachable, and welcoming. I would recommend this place to anyone visiting or living in Vegas. Stack is the place to be!

Everything here tasted amazing! I had the meatballs which come in a delicious sauce. I also had a side of the baked mac-and-cheese, which is pretty much an amazing carbonara pasta. My friend's steak was a little undercooked, but the flavor was great. And they brought us a cute dessert for our birthdays! And our server was extremely attentive to our party of 6!Highly recommend.

Stack was definitely not the steakhouse restaurant I was expecting. While the decor fit the restaurant theme- dim mood lighting and dark, rich wood walls- the menu was a bit more "fun" than your average steakhouse. 

We started with the following apps:
Pigs in a blanket- FUN! Who has pigs in a blanket on the menu. Great lil smoky sausages wrapped in buttery flaky pastry served with a small carafe of BBQ sauce. Good stuff.
Yellowtail Crunch- Mini "tostadas" of fresh diced yellowtail, mixed with a slightly spicy sauce and served a top a crispy won ton disk. Yum!
Adult Tater Tots- Now I'm not a fan of Brie, but fry it up and mix it up with bacon, oh yeah, everything is better with bacon :) Great!!
Pan Seared Dumplings- Steamed, pillowy soft clouds of a chicken/pork/veggie mix. Great crisp "crust" on the base from the sear served with a zingy soy dipping sauce. 

For my main dish, I chose the Petite Filet Mignon. A 9oz filet, tender and simply seasoned. Mm, mmm!
We also got a few sides for our main courses:
Crunchy Steakhouse Fries- Crispy, thick cut potatoes with truffle oil and parmesan. Yum!
Baked Mac 'n' Cheese- This looked good, but truth be told as someone who doesn't do well with too much cheese, I passed on this one. 
Green Bean- we needed at least some green! Simply crisp steamed green beans. 

Because we hadn't indulged enough...we had to have dessert!
Banana Cream Pie Bites- Petite mini bites of a smooth banana cream pie. 
Munchkin Jelly Donuts- Sugar coated puffs of jelly filled donuts.

Service was prompt, friendly and efficient. Food came out well timed but quick. Refills provided and plates cleared promptly. 

A bit more of a casual steakhouse, with some fun, yummy offerings not normally found in other steakhouses. 

I really enjoyed my meal and the service was great. I would definitely return!

Have had dinner at Stack on two separate occasions.  Both times the food was amazing.  

My first visit with friends, about a year ago, we shared the porter house and 2lb stuffed lobster.  They were terrific.  My second visit, yesterday, I was looking forward to the porter house again, but they no longer offered it.  So I chose the the scallops and a side of the brie & bacon tater tots.   The tater tots were absolutely fabulous!

Great place to dine. Will be definitely going back here on my next visit to Vegas.

Food was excellent! Our whole party of 4 enjoyed every dish we ordered.

Loved cooking your own beef on the hot stone, meatballs were very flavorful. All of our meats were cooked to perfection and melty goodness. Tasty sides as well- tried the Tots, Mac n cheese, whipped potatoes and asparagus. 

Would've been 5 stars if it not were for the thumping bass/ club music. We did ask our server if they could turn it down, which they did, but I think the acoustics weren't built for hearing conversations.

But would def recommend to friends.

I've had a lot of steaks but this Filet was the most tender and tasteful one by far.  We also had the Chilean sea bass which was delicious and combined greatly with the lobster risotto. The service was great and there was perfect ambiance. Great date night spot!

This is a tough rating.  We'll go simple with Pros/Cons.

Pros: Incredible steaks - truly, one of the best steaks I have ever had anywhere (filet mignon and my husband's new york strip were perfectly cooked).  The mac and cheese is to die for.  I was jealous I didn't order this myself after tasting it.  Huge side portions for a nice steakhouse.

Cons: There really isn't anywhere to sit while waiting to be seated, except on the casino floor - kind of awkward.  Also, the music is way too loud.  I know I always sound like an old lady when I say that - but there were 8 of us here for dinner at a roundtable in the center of the restaurant and I could not hear what anyone said except for the people seated immediately to either side of me.

Conclusion: if you are trendier than I am, don't want to talk to your friends for an hour or so, but enjoy a great steak - you'll want to give this a go

I absolutely LOVED this place, yes it's expensive but I knew that going in and it was definitely worth it. This place is perfect for me because rarely can I find an awesome seafood dish at the same price as the steak, seems silly but when the guy is paying and he orders a steak I don't want to order something way more expensive, any hooo! My point, it was one of the 3 best meals I have ever had! The lobster was PERFECT and was huge! The mash potatos were delish!!! and I normally don't even like them. Great wine and everything is worth the price. We had a huge group which Im sure was annoying but everyone was nice and helpful, BIG PLUS

AHHH I am starving now!

Love the atmosphere & vibe. The drinks are great. The menu offers many choices - all are uniquely created and delicious. Portions are generous.  Great presentation. The staff is knowledgeable & friendly without hovering. A few times our party ordered martinis, 3-4 appetizers suggested by staff, and individual salads - perfect for a fun night.  Dinners are very good. Desserts are delicious.  Pricey but worth it. Highly suggest this place.

I'm ashamed to admit this, but I walked out of this place a few years ago while on vacation with a friend....hence, we are no longer friends.  She originally picked this place based on a martini she wanted on the menu.  We sat down, they said they no longer made that particular martini and for some reason the $50 steak we said we'd get for dinner was no longer what she wanted for dinner.  I told HER to tell our server we were leaving...she just didn't want to eat there.  Since then I HAVE wanted to go back because I always like a GOOD meal for my final night while visiting Vegas and I go every year.

Fast forward to 2014, last week to be specific.  I already told my friends about my previous experience of not eating here and they were down for whatever.  I don't know how Stack compares to the other higher end restaurants in the Mirage but I was determined to eat here regardless.

For starters, I was super impressed with the wine, drink, and dessert menu on an ipad...fancy schmancy!  Being my last night in Vegas I figured I had to split payment (cash/charge) for this meal and asked if we could get separate checks.  I must have asked our waiter too many questions because he kept his cool though I sensed I was getting a bit annoying...I did compensate him with a tip larger than 20% on my portion of the bill.

I ordered the petite filet, adult tater tots, and a glass of cab.  YUM-O!!!! They were all amazing!!! Yes, expensive but you get what you pay for with good quality restaurants.  My friends loved their meals as well - one ordered steak and the other ordered salmon I believe...I'm not sure, I was too into my own meal throughout dinner.

We couldn't decide on one thing for dessert so we got the dessert sampler and everything that came on there was amazing as well.

Go here...really, just go!!!!!!!! 
...and stay for your meal, too! :)

Pretty impressed with this place, but the service kept it from getting a fifth star.  Had the Sea Bass here and it was one of the best I had ever had.  A friend got this huge "stack" of different shellfish that we all shared and it was great too.  The service (drinks primarily) were really slow which is never good for the mood of a large party there for a birthday in Vegas.  I definitely like the food though

Delicious food but the worst service in town.  Management really needs to look into retraining their staff starting with the hostess and working their way down through servers.  

Arrived at 5:52pm for a 6pm reservation on a Monday night to a relatively deserted restaurant and were told we had to wait 8 minutes to be seated- and would have to wait at the end of the ramp since we had 2 children with us and they weren't allowed in the bar.  (note:  the bar part isn't the problem, we wouldn't bring kids into the bar, but really..... sending us 10ft from the hostess stand to wait exactly 8 minutes was rude)

Seated:  Drinks were slow to arrive and the bar was completely empty.  Two bartenders literally standing around doing nothing.  Appetizers took almost 30 minutes.  Food runners had to circle around waiting for someone to clear the apps for entrees.  Had to continually flag someone down for drink refills, check on our food, get our check, check on dessert, clear the plates.  Just ridiculous and disappointing.

On a happy note, the tuna tartare and scallops were amazing which saved it from getting 1 star.  With so many restaurants to choose from with much better service, I hope they step their game up because the food is delicious, just not worth the headache.

This is a difficult place to review but first let me say I'm not stranger to expensive restaurants and certainly don't mind paying for quality. Stack is simply overpriced. The ambience is great. The service is exceptional. The food is delicious but there is VERY LITTLE of it for the exorbitant prices they charge. A $21 shrimp cocktail contained 4 shrimp. You get a singe small crab cake for $22. The drink prices were even worse. TWENTY FIVE dollars for a margarita that was pretty light on liquor despite the small bottle of Grand Marnier that accompanies it. You'll leave hungry and around $130 lighter if you come here for drinks/appetizers.

I have to say this place is amazing. My hubby and I came here Monday night for dinner. (8/3/2015). We made reservations for 8pm and when we got there we were seated right away. The ambiance is beautiful. This place is great for a romantic dinner or with a group of people. Our server was wonderful. He was very attentive to our needs. I ordered the Sea Bass with lobster risotto which was sooooooooo delicious. We also had the Mac & Cheese, Adult Tater Tots & Pigs in a Blanket which were all good. We also had Drinks which were very good but also expensive. ($25).  Since we were celebrating our Wedding Anniversary that week we figured we could splurge a little. On a regular day I wouldn't pay $25 for a drink. Lol! I would highly recommend this restaurant if your visiting Las Vegas. It's in the Mirage Hotel.

I'd have to say their food is not bad.  First off tho, I do feel like the seafood platter is not anything special than if you were to buy fresh seafood at home and eat it that way..so SKIP it.  Save the money for their actual food.  

Hot Rocks - Yummy..but pricey as hell!  $21 for 5 slices of thinly sliced beef (and not even like waygu beef) that you grill on a..well..HOT ROCK..with sauce on the side.  It's good but so pricey for what it is.   If i end up winning money in vegas, I would probably order it again 

Black Cod Tacos - I'm not even sure if they have this anymore.  Their current menu shows crab.  But this was the BEST dish we ordered.   We initlally ordered the seafood platter, Hot Rocks and something else that probably didn't wow me cuz i forgot.  Might have been seabass.  Anyhoo,  during the end, I decided i was not full at all so i wanted to order these tacos and SO glad i did, they were SOO good.  The best of everything we ordered. 

The bill came out pretty steep for 2 ppl. I'd say after tips, it was about $180 (and again, i was not filled).  To sum it up, the hot rocks was good but way too pricey so booooo.   The best thing we ordered were the tacos (compared to 4 items we ordered).  If they put my black cod tacos back on the menu), i might come back..but after I give other restaurants on the strip a shot.

The owners of light group put together this restaurant in the Mirage and it's almost an identical menu as FIX in the Bellagio. Dinner for 4, 3 cocktails, 3 appetizers, 3 salads, 4 entrees, 2 sides, 2 deserts. $460.

The waiter suggested I try the Kurabota pork chop. I am a pork snob and I'm obsessed with anything pig. Besides, us Hawaii folks know how to cook up some delicous pork. It tasted like a normal pork chop, that I would've prepared on the grill at the beach. My friend had the surf and turf. That was delicious and my other half had the sea bass with lobster risotto. I'd give that a thumbs down. I didn't particularly care for the risotto swimming in lobster broth. Don't order  the calamari, you can get better calamari at some local dive bar. The popcorn shrimp was alright. The miso cod lettuce wraps were also okay. I loved the truffle fries and the chili cheese fries. I don't get what the big deal is with the jelly stuffed donut holes and the chocolate souflet was a disappointment. Way over priced for small portions and limited imagination.

Arrgh!  They completely dropped the ball and caused us to be 10 minutes late for the 7:00pm LOVE Cirque du Soleil show.  After making a reservation for 6 people at 5:30pm, and being asked if we were attending any shows or had any time restrictions, I didn't think we had much to worry about, since we sat for dinner, in an empty restaurant at precisely 5:30pm.

The hostess was pleasant and confirmed the showtime as we were being sat, and I was sure to reiterate this time with the person who I originally thought was our server.  We had expected to enjoy the prix fixe show special menu for $30, but was not offered that menu.  When the server came back to finally take a drink order after a 10 minute wait (while he stood talking in the side station with other staff members, well within our view), we asked about the special menu.  He walked away without a word, picked up 'one' special menu and casually dropped it into the center of the table and walked away.

When he came back with drinks and to take our order (he never asked if we had any questions, nor did he offer to explain any highlights or specials), half of our party attempted to order the special menu, and the other half wanted to order a la carte.  The server informed us that it wasn't possible, and that the entire table had to order the special menu.  It is unfortunate that this wasn't mentioned on the phone, because we were all on a budget, and had to go back to the regular menu to choose another meal.

To add insult to injury, I ended up ordering 2 appetizers (spicy crab and black cod), which ended up costing more than the 3 course prix fixe.  For $17, the spicy crab appetizer was the equivalent of 4 tiny 1.5" square bites, and the black cod (almost identical to the signature NOBU dish, which is phenomenally more delicious & original), was only 3 butter lettuce cups with aprox. 1oz of fish in each one.

Lastly, the $12-$14 cocktails took almost as long as the food to reach the table (again, I reiterate that we were now 1 of 3 tables in the entire restaurant).  After we ordered coffee, and one dessert (the coffees were spilled all over the saucers and table, and no one ever attempted to apologize or clean up), I reminded the person delivering the coffee to tell my server (for the 3rd time) that we had to leave in 10 minutes to attend the show, and that we would like our check.  After 5 more minutes, I had to walk around looking for the server, only to have to ask him yet again.  The check was finally dropped at 5 minutes to 7:00pm, at which time we had to get up and bring the check to the server for processing, (who was now leaning in the front of the restaurant, joking and laughing with co-workers, within eye-shot of the manager, who had also been leaning on a bar table talking during our entire dinner).

We ended up being 10 min late for the show and had to wait outside the doors to be seated.  All in all and overwhelmingly terrible and embarrassing experience.  I can see why this restaurant was so empty...

Came here after seeing Love. Good service, we had 2 servers. Ordered the steak and hamburger. The steaks are a la carte, so have to order sides separately but they serve 2 people. Also through Yelp was able to claim free shooters which was great.

My friend has raved about this place so much, so I was excited when she finally took me here. But sadly that night, they must have been off their game.

We had reservations for a party of three and was quickly taken to our table, the restaurant was actually very empty. After we were seated a waiter came and brought us the drink menu on an iPad (very tech-y!) and we ordered drinks. I thought to myself, it was gonna be a good dinner because service was so quick, but I was really wrong. We ordered two appetizers, the hot rocks and the pigs in a blanket. The entrees we all got were the stack burger, caesar salad and the tomato soup. We got sides to share as well.

Once we ordered we really waited FOREVER for our food. The appetizers came a good 20 minutes after we ordered. And we finished our appetizers and waited another 20 or so minutes for our entrees. They didn't even bring our side dishes, they must have forgotten or something. I was a little disappointed about their service because the restaurant was so empty, I would be much more understanding if the place was packed but it wasn't at all!

The food was okay, my favorite was the hot rocks appetizer because the citrus ponzu sauce was delicious, but the serving size is so tiny. I would want to order 5 of them if I could! The rest of the food wasn't anything super special and I've had better in other restaurants.

Make reservations!!! If you don't you might be able to eat at the bar.  The bar area waitresses might be a little slow but they look like they are models that serve.  The back restaurant sections has professional waitstaff. The food was excellent.  Great place if you are staying at the Mirage or going to one of the Mirage's clubs for a moderately priced really nice meal. Don't forget to make reservations!!

stack is one of the all around best restaurants in LV. just  great menu awesome food and amazing service. when we arrived we were sat right away. i was dehydrated from hours of drinking and every second i turned around my water glass was filled. we all had the same thing tomato soup with little grilled cheese sandwiches and the surf and turf. the soup was very very good not to salty which most places tend to do. the surf and turf is the perfect size. some might say the lobster tail was small but to me it was perfect especially for the price. Stack is one of the restaurants i try to visit every time i go to Vegas.

We went with a party of 11. The staff was very nice & suggested meals. It took over an hour to get our first course which was mostly salads, a soup and one order from the raw bar; not anything that should've taken that long to prepare. Several of us had cuts of steak and were happy. I have to say my 9oz filet was the best steak I've ever eaten. It was cooked to perfection, red and juicy on the inside and crispy on the outside. It was so incredibly flavorful that I didn't want to use any of the sauces it came with. Everyone seemed happy with their meals: sea bass with lobster risotto, roasted chicken, spaghetti & meatballs. The whipped potatos & Mac & cheese with ham & peas were delicious sides. The adult tater tots with brie & bacon were disappointing; they were stuffed & didn't taste anything like brie & had a "bacos" flavor.

I picked Stack because it's owned by the same company that owns FIX (which was out of the world). Luckily I was able to make a reservation for the same day as the Love show. 

We started off with pigs in a blanket and the spicy Japanese crab, The pigs in a blanket were just like the ones you would get at any cocktail party - amazing! The spicy Japanese crab was just okay - I did not think it was bad per say, it was just not my taste. It was shredded crab on top of rice and lightly covered with a citrus soy sauce. 

For dinner I had the stacked Kobe beef burger with grown up tater tots. The Kobe beef burger was really good, but I didn't not care for the tater tots. They were stuffed with brie cheese and bacon. I think the bacon is what threw me off, I would have liked them if they were just filled with potato and brie cheese. 

I then had to have the jelly donut munchkins with vanilla dipping sauce for dessert. OMG!!!! They were amazing. When I bit into these I thought  I was in heaven. Just thinking about them makes my mouth water. 

Other than the food, the staff was outstanding, the decor is chic and the food presentation is very clever. For example when the jelly donuts came out, they were stacked in a mini cardboard box that said stack all over it (it looked like a DD munchkin box). 

I am so glad I was able to come here. I will defiantly be coming back the next time I am in Vegas!

I went here with a bridal group on our respective bachelorette /bachelor parties. They were great to work with our large party. They have large round tables which made it much more fun to talk to people. 

Really cool ambiance- the decor is simple but beautiful- swanky, elegant with a sort of earthy feel with the carved interior walls. The drink menu looked fabulous. The food menu was also great- I highly recommend the halibut and the steak on a rock (or whatever they call it).  The prices were a little high, but seemed on par with most other places on the strip. 

Limited menu, I would not recommend this for gluten-free, vegetarian or vegans. Although, everything our party tried was delicious. 

Great service, overall great experience. I would recommend this to those looking for a gourmet treat without the super-foody snobbery.

Very yummy here.  The steaks were very tender and tasty.  The sides were very good too,  we had Mac and cheese and  tatter tots and potato gratin.    I would rank them in that order.     The tatter toots being surprisingly good!   The steaks were really.   Roasted tomato soup was very good as was the Caesar salad.  Desserts were ok,  but I'd skip them if I had a redo.

On the whole a really good steak restaurant,  we would all come back again!

This was one of the highlights of the Mirage. I had a great prix fixe meal before the Terry Fator show and it was both nice and intimate and happening and vibrant. The wood paneling on the ceilings reminds you of the Grand Canyon, but the seating is much more comfortable.

The starter was basically a grilled cheese sandwich and tomato soup. Which is for me the ultimate comfort food. But I have to say it was the best grilled cheese sandwich and tomato soup I ever had and I still cannot recreate the thing at home. The steak was amazing, I ordered medium and it was exactly right. And the homemade doughnut holes. I laughed about it till I tried them in the dipping sauce. It was like drinking a flan it was so good. I will never laugh at doughnut holes again. 

Best of all, the service was so fast I had no problem making my show, but it wasn't so fast that they were rushing me out. It was very obvious that they were really expert at getting people in and out for the show efficiently. And it was just enough food not to make me uncomfortable sitting in a theater for 90 minutes. 

One day when I get back to Vegas I'll have to try the full menu, considering how their "fast food" came out, it's got to be awesome. Great job everyone.

Why why why must restaurants on the strip disappoint me so?

The skinny: Menu is very limited, food is overpriced, service is bad....the only positive thing about this restaurant is that it's pretty. And there's a DJ?


The food:
Shared the Hot Rocks, which sounded and looked way cooler than the dish ended up being. It's like trying to be a cool version of KBBQ, where you cook your own sliver of beef on a lava rock? But the beef was mediocre at best, and for $21 it was not worth it. 

They try to sell this place as a steak house... but that pic you see up at the top of the page with the steak and melted butter + asparagus? LIES. The petit filet was dry, and when it came out the butter was definitely still cold and not half melted. 
($49)

I ordered the "Stack" burger - which was overall a good burger. Nice thick patty (Kobe beef, which made it nice and juicy) and bibb lettuce and tomatoes etc were all fresh. I ordered it medium, and it was pink in the middle. BUT it came with the WORST seasoned fries I've ever tried. I don't think I've ever come across a french fry I didn't like, until now :(  How do you screw up french fries? They were hard, cold, but yet spicy. Oh, and it came with a "dipping sauce"...aka ketchup  -___-;; 
($34)

My friend ordered the Salmon, which came with this crispy fried waif of a rice cracker, which was just really really bland. And the spinach was probably the healthiest spinach I've ever tried....straight up just boiled. 
($38)

Overall, the for what it cost, the food was grossly disappointing. Also, very limited vegetarian options. 

The Service: 
I hate to rag on wait staff, I do. And I get that it was a busy Fri night. But this place was like "amateur hour". Our waiter was a little rude, did not know anything about the menu, never refilled my soda, and it took close to 1.5 hours to finally get our food (reservation at 8:30, we did not get our food until after 10pm). Seriously, this is the 2nd slowest restaurant in LV! 

Definitely won't be back.

The Mirage has stepped up its game.  Two memorable meals in a row !!  Stack was amazing last night.   I had the bone in dry aged sirloin and my colleague has the bone in filet.   We both agreed it was one of the best (if not the best) steaks we have had eating out.    The adult tater tots are incredible with a gooey Brie and bacon center.  I think the ketchup has a smokey flavor to it as well.  The baked mac and cheese was completely finished.  Very cheesy and crunchy with the Panko.   However the finishing touch was the jelly doughnuts.  That sweet sugary dough was perfect after the grilled steaks and savory dishes.   I normally just pop into Stack for the tater tots and a glass of Jordan but we went all out tonight.

I am a fan of this restaurant, actually a BIG FAN! Everything was so delicious from drinks to food and wish I had room to order dessert. The ambiance is very classy and it was perfect for a ladies night. I will definitely recommend this restaurant to any friends and will make it a necessary stop when I am in Vegas!

My husband and I had 6pm reservations here on memorial day.  We were seated right a way.  Though the menu is small, there was a bunch of things we wanted to try.  I ordered the 9oz filet med well and he the pork chop med.  We got the whipped potatoes to share.  We defiantly could have gotten two of those.  The filet was perfect and just melted in your mouth.  The pork chop was a bit fatty, and it was hard to see that in the dim light.  But after he got through the fat he liked it. The staff was super nice.  A bit pricy though!  Would defiantly return and recommend.

We decided to visit stack since the Kardashians always have it on their show. 
We shared the Hot rocks, they were highly suggested. They were whatever, not really impressed. I had the salmon w/seasonal vegetables. I loved it, it was so delicious. Jaime had the Brooklyn filet medium rare,he really enjoyed it. I had a taste and it was sooo sooo good. We shared the tots, which is a MUSTTTT!! W also shared the seared spinach which were really tasty as well. 

Would I visit this restaurant again? Maybe just for the tots.

Ate on the night of the 5th of Sept.  The whole city was quite as being the middle of the week after labor day.  We got there at 9pm and they made us wait 5 mins - they were probably  expecting us that we order drinks first before they showed us our table in the half empty restaurant.  I looked at the menu and yes being that it is dark, I had to put the candle in  front of my menu to read.  I was not interested with anything on the menu because I am not a seafood or steak eater.  Yes, they had lamb and chicken on the menu but neither of them sounded good.  Started with the rock - 6 thinly sliced sirlon on a hot rock.  okay, we were very  hungry at this point. The thinly slice is correct as we were told to put the meat for 3-5 secs for medium.   I ended up with a Kobe burger well done and Tater tots.  FYI - the burger comes with fries as this was not mentioned in the menu so in my case I ended up with fries and tater tots.   The girl had chicken with a side order of onion rings.  We were both afraid that our meals will disappoint us as what we ordered shouldn't be $40 per person.   Boy we were wrong.  My Kobe burger was the best I have eaten and do not bother to bite the burger with your hands. Use the fork as it was quite tall.   The tater tots with cheese was really good - I mean first time ever feeling good.   Her chicken plate was also very good as the meat was cooked to perfection for her.
