We split a burger, tater tot, and wing lollipops.  All were good - I especially liked the burger - tasty and well seasoned.  The tater tots were good but could have been crispier.  The wings were cool looking but not far off from Roosters when it comes to flavor.
Everything we tried was outstanding.  One of the best steaks on the strip and the tater tots were a must.

This really was a great restaurant to eat at. I got the Hot Rocks which was so good... and also an entertaining meal. 

They give you a platter of thinly sliced steak. You put it on your hot rocks for just a few seconds to cook. It's a really cool idea. I had a blast doing my own cooking at the restaurant. 

Great atmosphere. Good service. Friendly staff.  Great drinks,  Free shot from Yelp App. And most important.... Great Food!!!

I guess we shoud have known that we weren't going to be totally wowwed when we came in around 8 without reservations and didn't have to wait at all. 

I came with a group of 4 people.  My husband and I had just spent $45 on 2 large frozen drinks and were asked if we couldn "finish em up real quick".  Um, no.  I'd either have brain freeze for 3 hours or be too full to eat anything in your restaurant.  Compromise reached.  They allowed us to leave them at the hostess stand.  Cool.  

The food was pretty good, if a little spendy ( I know, Vegas, whatever) but service was pretty bad.  I would be ok with that but they weren't even busy. So, there are too many other really good restaurants in such a small area to go to Stack and get bad service.

Pleasantly surprised by this place. If I weren't staying at The Mirage, I probably would have never sought this place out, but alas, we decided to check it out. For whatever reason, I thought it was a sports bar, but when I actually walked into the dining area, I realized how beautiful the atmosphere is.

The food was solid. We got a bunch of apps - yellow tail with jalapeno, the thinly sliced beef with hot rock, crispy calamari, crab cakes, and miso black cod lettuce cups. Each dish was delicious. I could have used bigger portions, but all in all, each dish was very flavorful and stood out in its own right. 

Service was only so-so.

I got food poising from the Kobe beef burger [that I had cooked well done]. Based on the meals I had that day and night, the burger was the only thing my friend didn't also eat, so...process of elimination points toward the burger. That being said, it tasted good going down...

We also had the buffalo drumettes and the crab tacos. They're actually pretty small, so definitely treat them as appetizers unless you plan to have them to yourself. Stack also serves its condiments in cutesy jars, but they come with a spoon, as if you're supposed to spoon out the amount that you wish to consume each time.

Lighting was a bit dim, but the decor was nice; wooden fixtures as if you were dining in a canyon. Service was so-so...the saving grace? The hostess consistently walking past our table to seat guests.

What an awesome dinner! We celebrated my daughter's 21st birthday at Stack and I'm so glad we chose it!  The service was impeccable start to finish. Drinks were all great. The cucumber martini is fabulous. We started with the hot rocks and totally enjoyed the experience and the flavorful meat. The food was top notch!  My fave was the Brooklyn Filet! The balsamic butter was killer and the steak was perfect plus I ordered the brussels! The seafood risotto was wonderful! Everyone enjoyed their food and we had fun with our waiters. A perfect celebration.

Ate there Thanksgiving Day. I had the 26 oz cowboy steak with mashed potatos as my side. The streak was cooked perfect and was very flavorful worth the $44.
My wife had the sirloin steak with Mack and cheese as her side. Sirloin was good but no where near as good as the cowboy steak. Both sides were wonderful. The service was good too water was kept filled. I rate this a 4.5 the only thing keeping it from getting a five is they don't offer any bread before the meal. The bill was $100.00 for two with no cocktails (we were drinking all day) I'd go back again.

I've been to Stack so many times I've lost count.  While most Las Vegas restaurants are very poor imitations of the originals, Stack is consistently good.  They've also held their prices unlike other Vegas establishments that think for some reason they should charge more for a meal/drink, etc. out in the middle of the desert vs. LA, NYC, London.  Ok, enough of my dislike for Vegas (I'm so glad the economy has cut the arrogant developers, hoteliers, etc. down to size, and I pitty the fools that thought that real estate in that God forsaken place would EVER be worth anything).

Every time I go to Stack I get the "pigs in a blanket", they are addictive.  I also LOVE the grilled cheese and tomato soup appetizer.  The steaks and sea bass are excellent, and make sure you get the "adult tater tots" as a side :) .

Great ambiance! Live DJ and dim lighting. The wait and bar staff are very good. The food is a little over priced for what they offer. Portions are typical of high end restraints, so I expected more flavor. Not as much bang for the buck. 

But if you are looking for a chill, classy spot to get a fun fruity drink, this is the spot!

this place is a disrespect to fine dining, i have never been to a restaurant and felt so pressured into ordering a certain item because they have such a crapy and small selection that u have no choice but to order the $30 blant burger... service is not all that either, the only thing that was great was my beer (blue moon) but wait thats someone elses product... never again and the only reason they got a one star is because i couldnt give them a zero star...

Not bad at all, Stack. 

Nice looking place with some creative twists. We ordered a couple drinks and apps after a show at the Mirage. Ended up sharing the lobster tacos and adult tator tots (stuffed with brie and bacon). 

Food was really good. Portions and prices, not so much. Like a lot of restaurants on the strip, over priced. But I certainly can't complain about the quality. 

The only other complaint I have on the place is that service was good, but somewhat confusing. The bartenders/waiters don't talk to each other at all. We had at least 3-4 different people trying to take our order in a 10 minute time period.

Good atmosphere. Good service. Good presentation. Everything is good. Nothing is bad. It's just not great. Here's the thing. If you are going to charge $40-$60 for a steak a-la cart you are comparing yourself to the top steakhouses, at least in price you have to deliver the goods on the meat. My tomahawk ribeye looked incredible with a huge bone in for show but it was all sizzle & no steak. It wasn't very tender.it was kind of chewy. Very chewy. So was my girlfriends filet. This is a personal preference maybe but I feel thicker cuts tend to be better. This was on the thinner side. Again not bad. The adult tater tots were good. My girlfriend's berry martini was amazing. The problem is the price versus the quality. If you want a great steak. I'd go to Mortons, Ruth's Chris, Del Frisco's etc. 10 X 10 over this place.

This place has nice location and a very hip bar scene. I don't really like sitting in the main dining room I love the bar scene. They have a wonderful selection of appetizers that make it great to munch on before a show or hitting the club. Also have a pretty tasty cocktail menu and a friendly staff. Must try their little wings and tatter tots stuffed with Brie and bacon. Mmmmm

We were blown away by how absolutely amazing the food was here!!! I'm not sure we could have asked for anything better than this!! The vibe here was perfect for us! They played quite a few remixes of hit music. The staff is very attentive. The drinks were also perfection!! We ordered oysters on the half shell, the small stack appetizer, hot rock appetizer, the ultimate surf and turf, sirloin steak, and the filet.  For sides we had the Mac n cheese, Brussel sprouts, broccoli, and tater tots!! Everything was delicious!! The size portions are also great and we had plenty to eat as well as some left over. We couldn't have been more pleased to eat here!! Looking forward to coming back for sure!! :)

Bad service from the host,  i approached the host not knowing reservation would be needed. So i asked if there was a way I could wait seens my wife wanted to eat here. The Host said No, lest than 1 minute later my wife approach a different host by herself and was immidiatetly sitted. I felt extremely discriminated. I did complained to the manager but I was not satisfied with the outcome, my impression is they only want to sit who they want to sit. Total discrimination, find a better place.

I've been to the stack about 4-5 times in the past, and I am finally reviewing it.  Stack is situated at the Mirage.  The decor is wonderful, and it definitely has good ambiance.  As far as food, I would give a solid 4/5.  I do not recommend getting the "hot rock" as the marinade is faint, and the portions are small for $20+ appetizer.  I really like the steaks they offer, however I do not recommend getting their "add-on" lobster tail for $30+.  The lobster tail was so small that I'd equate to about 2 jumbo shrimps. I felt the value was terrible for those two items.  They get 5/5 for service as I've never had bad service here.  If you're out celebrating something, I highly recommend this restaurant.  

P.S. Their dessert sampler was to die for.

Just got home from Las Vegas. I have never had such a wonderful dining experience. 
Stack. The staff,  the service, the quality and taste of food was excellent!
A perfect experience from the moment we arrived til we said our goodbyes. 
We will absolutely return to the Mirage, and best server ever, Scott. 
The Stack is our new favorite place .
Ate here with 12 other girls in July. Got the pre fixe menu... it was amazing... wish I had 2 stomachs to eat ALL the food. Can't wait to go back.

I thought this place would be more crowded on the Friday night before July 4th, but to my surprise it was fairly empty. The waitstaff was very attentive. They were like "water ninjas" who would constantly sneak in to fill your water glass without disrupting your conversation.  We had the Signature Wings to start with (Buffalo Lollipop style). These were a tad spicier than they had to be. I like hot spicy wings as much as the next guy, but these seemed to go a little over the top to the point where they weren't that flavorful. They did come off the bone nicely though. Just be aware that these are more than medium hotness. My wife had the Brooklyn Filet (basically a bone-in filet mignon) which she thought was very tasty and cooked to her liking (she's not usually easy to please with steaks). I had the seabass on the lobster risotto, which was done well and tasty. It combines three of my favorite things. We also had the "Adult Tater Tots" which have a bacon flavor and have some brie inside. Maybe its just me, but the taste didn't quite add up to how good it sounded (or maybe the hot wings had killed my sense of taste by that point). Overall I would recommend it. It ranks slightly below some of my other favorite upscale Las Vegas Strip restaurants thus giving only 4 stars, but is still very solid and has a wide enough variety on the menu.

Came here with my girls for a Bachelorette party. We all got the tasting menu and every single thing was so yummy. Each item they brought out was simple and delicious with a kick. The night got even better when our waitress brought out free (yelp check in) shots for all of us! Thank you so much! Love the service and the atmosphere. I'd recommend this place to people looking for good food, awesome service and a fun atmosphere.

We have been to Stack many times, and the service has always been great. Tonight though, was a huge disappointment. Although the food was good, service was terrible. To begin with, the wine list had the wrong year for the wine we ordered. Second, I ordered the bone-in Ribeye; but about a half hour after getting our starters, the waiter said that they ran out of them. He said that a group of 18 guys, who came in after us, all ordered them, and the restaurant ran out. Then, when our entrees eventually came out, they brought three at a time, and about 5 minutes apart. The first three in our group were almost done with their entrees, when the side dishes eventually made their way to the table. The evening was a huge disappointment. To make things worse, they automatically tacked on a 18% gratuity since we had 9 in our party.

Excellent way to celebrate our anniversary!  The Sea bass served over lobster risotto was superb! The Salmon accompanied by spinach and potatoes was incredibly delicious! 
We enjoyed the challenge of cooking & savored the  steak Hot Rocks appetizer and shared a fresh & flavorful salad - plenty to share.
The Berrylicious was sweet and satisfying,  and the Alibi Sour was worth repeating!  Our complimentary champagne for toasting was the perfect touch! Friendly service in a beautiful setting makes it worthy of a return trip!

I DON'T GET IT!!!!

I know that this review is crazy long, but if I'm only going to give it one star, I want to explain why. 

My husband and I are in our 40's, full time RVers, and have traveled to 41 of the lower 48 states. We've literally eaten almost everywhere, and eaten all different kinds of food, at all different price points, all across the nation. Prior to the RV thing, we lived in AZ, so two of our best friends from AZ came up to join us for the weekend. My girlfriend wanted to go to Giada, but they were booked, so I checked Yelp - SINCE I TRUST YOU GUYS - to find another option. Adult Tater Tots got my husband's attention, so I made a reservation. 

My friends decided that what they really wanted was everything on the appetizer menu, so we just decided to get a bunch of those, and share everything, instead of doing real courses. Here's what we ordered:

3 Manhattans: $19.00 each
Iced Tea: $4.00
Bottle of Zin $69.00
Water: $7.00
Crab Tacos: $23.00
Wings: $21.00
Oysters Rockefeller: $21.00
Ahi Tuna Tartare: $19.00
Adult Tater Tots: $11.00
Pigs in Blankets: $17.00
Kobe Burger and Fries: $34.00
Dessert Sampler: $18.00

Plus tax = $325.38

Manhattan: One of my husbands favorite drinks, and one of the best he's ever had. I know this, because I don't actually like them, but this one was fantastic. Worth $19? I'm not really sure.

Iced Tea:  it was tea. That's it. No interesting flavors or anything, and they couldn't seem to keep it filled. I was driving, so I wasn't drinking, and I know that this is the cheapest thing on the menu, but c'mon guys, somebody had to drive.

Zinfandel: can't really tell you about this one - my friends ordered the bottle and didn't mention anything about it. I didn't taste it, because I don't care for red wine. 

Fiji Bottled Water:  we had to order this because (I don't know if you know this) Las Vegas is in the desert. Water is essential. The water glasses were about 6 ounces each, and when my husband asked if we could have a carafe at the table, we were told that they couldn't leave one. So he ordered a bottle. They couldn't keep my tea filled, and it was even worse with the water. 

FOOD: Presentation on EVERYTHING was beautiful, it all LOOKED great!

Crab Tacos: 4 to an order, and they were teeny! Approximately 2 - 2 1/2" long each. Maybe an inch and a half high. They were tasty, but completely unseasoned. It was crab, in a crispy taco shell, with a thin slice of jalapeño and a sprig of cilantro on top of each. Served with a side of salsa, which did not seem house made, but may have been. 

Wings: Served "lollipop style" which means that I think that they were from the part of the wing with the two bones in it, but with only one bone and the meat pushed to the "top" - they looked like the "drumstick" ones, but tiny, once again. They were perfectly cooked, not dried out, which is impressive, considering their size. There were about a dozen, with two pieces each of celery and carrot and a side of blue cheese. They were buffalo wings, about medium spiciness. Again, nothing special. If you're looking for wings, Buffalo Wild Wings does a better, meatier job. 

Oysters:  fine, but 5 small oysters, served with one tiny bottle of Tabasco and one lemon wedge. No crackers. 

Ahi Tuna: in my opinion, the BEST THING we ate, and the most reasonable portion for the money. A bowl of cubed ahi (maybe about 3-4 ounces) atop cubed avocado, served with shrimp chips and soy sauce. 

Tater Tots:  considering that everything we ate was so small, these were ginormous by comparison! 6 to an order, and about 2-3 times the size of an average tater tot. Yes, they were flavored with Brie and bacon, but I couldn't actually see either. There wasn't enough in there. Served with ketchup on the side. No house made dipping sauce or remoulade or anything, just plain ketchup. 

Pigs in Blankets:  unfortunately, exactly what you're thinking. About a dozen Hillshire Farms tiny dogs wrapped in a small amount of puff pastry, served with French's mustard and Heinz ketchup. For $17.00. (If you're wondering what I was expecting, one of my favorite restaurants in the world is Odd Duck in Austin TX. There, they make a "breakfast corn dog" with house made chorizo and a Dijon mustard foam that's to die for. And I don't even like chorizo.)

After that, the boys were still hungry, so they split the Kobe burger. The meat was amazing, and cooked to perfection (I did take a bite of my husband's half) but, at $34, it just came with plain old normal fries and ketchup. Not even garlic or anything on the fries to make them interesting. 

Dessert sampler: buffet of tiny desserts. Fruit ones were good. 

My husband asked why I only gave the restaurant one star. Here's the thing: the food was fine. Everything was cooked fine. But at these prices, the food was minuscule. And there was nothing spectacular about ANY component of anything. Which was a real bummer.

For a special evening out to dinner, much like a birthday or anniversary celebration, this place is wonderful. There were next to zero variables from this place that dissatisfied me. For what I was looking for, a cool delicious and upscale place to celebrate a birthday, I found what worked well. It is a very hip atmosphere, dim amber lighting a contemporary canyon motif radiating with electronic music from a house DJ. The food, expensive as a given, was very good. Just prepare to spend a lot of money on what is definitely worth it for how special a place it really is. Service is also top-notch, we didn't have to ask for a thing and the waiter certainly earned his generous tip. (Plus the tender behind the bar mixing drinks was adept.)

if I had one observation it would be that it wasn't very crowded, given we ate on a Tuesday night at 9:15. If you are looking for a very lively bar scene you might wanna find many of the thousands of hip bars in Vegas. However it was quiet and intimate which allowed me to focus on my party members.

Eat here, you won't leave disapointed

I never eat in hotel restaurants, but my crew had heard good things about this spot and we were staying in the hotel. We decided to indulge.

Now granted, I was definitely under the influence of alcohol by our 8 p.m. reservation, but the large filet I consumed was literally the best streak I've ever eaten. Grilled to a perfect medium-rare, super tender and with a tasty, but faint sauce that really allowed the meat to shine.

Don't get me wrong, it was fucking expensive. But it's Vegas, go big or go home.

I had a chance to visit here last weekend  and have dinner once again and everything was amazing.  The perfect place to catch dinner before a show and the service was exceptionally excellent.  We came here for a pre show anniversary dinner and started with the ahi tuna tartare.  So yummy.  Dinner was the lobster risotto and pan seared chicken with mac and cheese. My husband loved it.  The best part was my dessert. The mini  banana cream pies with malted chocolate ice cream. Definitely would visit again and enjoyed the ambiance as well.

great restaurant!  Great food, hot rocks appetizers were really tasty and fun to make!  Service was great and décor is awesome.  If you're thinking of visiting this restaurant I recommend it, I went with a group of 8 girls and everyone loved it!

Energetic bar/pub style fare very high on the refinement scale. Even though the decor is very far from the typical pub with nice wood panels (stacks of wood, hence the name), menu is deliberately dominated by pub-like items like buffalo wings, onion rings and pigs in a blanket. Sharing is encouraged. They also offer steaks and other hearty main courses.

They have an original appetizer called Hot Rock which is a carpaccio style piece of seasoned and oiled beef which the patron cooks on err... an hot rock. Great taste and original. However, the chef should really reconsider the practice of serving Heinz ketchup and yellow mustard to go along the finger food. At least home made laternatives should be proposed. Wine list is decent.

Service was amazing! 
Props to the Roasted Tomato Soup, it was fabulous!
The appetizers were really fun, Pigs in a Blanket and Short Rib Meatballs were delish, Adult Tater Tots were a little rich but worth a try. 
Drinks: Pineapple Mojito was a little too sweet but the Chopin Shandy rocked!

Our food was great and te service was very good.  I really like that they have bone-in steaks!  There were ten in our party, all the steaks were perfectly cooked, but one burger was under cooked.  they replaced it very quickly though.

Here is my breakdown:  GF and I show up at 9:30pm on a Friday starved, slightly intoxicated, and ready for a fun time - and boy did Stack deliver....after getting over our "wow this is just Fix in Bellagio only with a different name," conversation, we decided to order.

The hot rocks with sliced beef - wow, LOVED this - I would eat the meat raw if they didn't bring the hot rocks (and those were a wonderful interactive touch).  Crabcake blt's - bring them on bc those little suckers were delicious!  Tiny potatoes stuffed with goat cheese, wow I never knew I loved carbs this much!

Add hot waitresses in little leather numbers, no line, and no pretentiousness, and I am a happy camper...Will return...Soon!

Pretty good for what it is.

Frankly, we filled up on all the gimmicky starters.  The bread included olive bread with a chive spread that was delicious.  We were in a junk food mood and ate a ton of the pigs in a blanket , tried the mini chili dogs (the equivalent to the sliders at sister restaurant Fix in the Bellagio), the onion rings, etc.  All tasty.  Oh!  They also have a roasted tomato soup served with miniature grilled cheese sandwiches.  MMMmmmm.

The steaks were great, too.  I tried the Cowboy steak, which was delicious.

Were were here, because we were going to see Cirque du Soleil's Love immediately afterwards, and it was a solid choice.

I first heard of Stack from an episode of Keeping Up with the Kardashians :-)  However, what truly caught my attention was the adult tater tots.  Stack has a wide variety of drink specials, including the cucumber martini (which I highly recommend).  The star of the night was the sea bass, it melts in your mouth and the lobster risotto makes a great co-star.  The drinks, sides and sea bass all provided a great start to 4th of July before going to see Jay Leno.

I wasn't expecting this place to be is good as it was. Located in the Mirage, the outside is unobtrusive and startlingly bland. But inside you get a peek of carved wooden walls that replicate a Reddish canyon. My friends and I had had drinks there the previous night and a lively discussion with the bartenders who were very helpful.

Zac was our waiter and what a delightful, educated person. He recommended the kale salad. Because I have certain diet restrictions my dinner companion and I were skeptical but decided to go with it. Sometimes kale is a tough sell, no pun intended. Outstanding appetizer. Yes they really do lovingly massage every leaf with lemon juice. I had the salmon and my buddy the steak. Someone back there knows their way around a grill. 

What I liked most about this place, other than the food, the music was not blaring or intrusive. The room hummed a melody versus convincing me I should be in an English Pub or Italian villa. 

I will definitely eat there again and recommend it to friends. Please ask for Zac has your server. He asks the right questions and does not pander for his tip.

The Food was All AMAZING! We orderedHot Rocks, yellowtail sashimi, wedge salad & Pan Seared Chickin w/tater tots instead of greenbeans. Ordered a $19 pineapple mojito, which seemed to be more for decoration then taste. There was little to no alcohol; I wouldn't buy it again.  Service was SUPER slow, sat down @ 9:20, complained about food at 10:20 and got food 5 min later. After we complained our waiter was NO where to be found, didnt see him back at our table ever. We ordered a bottle of Fiji & a waiter kept pouring tap water from a pitcher in our glasses... The food was AMAZING I must admit! Our waiter who went MIA, also forgot to substitute the green beens for tots but I ate both so I wasn't mad! 

Bottom line: 
VERY GOOD food, expensive $$$$ for what you get! RUDE waiters, POOR service.
Im here now and almost out of phone battery and felt the need to write this review and give it 5 stars... Best filet, awesome salmon, mac n cheese to die for.... And hubby loves the tator tots...

Fantastic spot for a fun group dinner in Vegas! We had a table of 12 hungry girls but they easily accommodated our party. 

We did a prix fixe menu. We started with the "pigs in a blanket," Caesar salads and spicy chicken wings. Everything was delicious. You could taste the anchovy lightly in the caesar and the wings and 'pigs' were hard not to devour. Each came with wonderful dipping sauces! 

For our entrees we had the roast chicken, truffle penne with proscuitto and peas and mashed potatoes and broccoli. The mashed potatoes were the best I've had in a long time. 

Raspberry filled donuts came out for dessert with a vanilla dipping sauce... Yum! Great meal before a night out dancing!

Was staying at the Mirage last weekend and wanted to have a nice meal for my husband and I since we rarely go anywhere "fancy" at home. I was gambling in the casino and saw Stack so I made reservations 4pm for 7:30pm. Got there about 7 minutes late but they seated us right away. 

Service was wonderful. We had two servers and both were knowledgeable and friendly. They use an iPad as a menu for drinks and desserts, which is pretty cool. Food was AMAZING! One of the best meals I have ever had. My husband and I both ordered a Petite Filet (mine medium rare and his medium well) and wow- that steak melted in your mouth. We shared the potatoes au gratin, which was also delicious. I ordered a glass of Pinot Noir, which was very nice. My husband ordered some mixed cocktail, which was also delicious.

This place is pricey ($180 with tip- that's with my glass of wine being free) but it is worth every darn penny. I will be coming back no doubt about it.

Expensive food for good experience. Nothing you couldn't find anywhere else. Their "hot rock" app. is good, but at the end of the day you are paying $20 for a few thin pieces of meat. I got the sea bass, which once again was quite good, but for $44, I want something extraordinary. Drinks and service were wonderful.

I would give this place 5 stars, but man, this place ain't cheap!  Most all cocktails from bar menu are $19. A bit pricey compare to Heritage Steak Lounge Bar or Lobby Bar, just right around the corner. 

After our trade show, we were hungry and thirsty. The cocktail menu comes in an iPad, which is okay, but takes some time to swipe right left, up and down.  Please bring back print menus! 

The cocktails were not too strong and were made perfectly.  Our bartenders (Justin if I recall), were great and very attentive.  

We got a dozen Kushi oysters ($4 each) and most were clean and was quite tasty.  The star of the appetizers was the hot rocks.  The beef is cut sashimi style and you lay it on the hot rock for 2-3 seconds each side and it is done.  Was it worth $22?  It sure was fun. 

I've stayed at Mirage many times and this was the first time here.  Mirage has many sit down restaurants (been to Pantry, Carnegie Deli, BLT Burger, Heritage Stack, and their buffet). Glad I stopped by here this time around.  Next time I will have to try their main entrees. Everyone wanted seafood, so we went to Joe's Seafood at Forum Shops (see my review).
I have come here over and over again and Stack still has the best burger I have ever had.  The penne dish is great, too!
I can't say enough good about the experience here! superb food,  service,  ambiance..perfection.

I had the 8oz filet. It was good BUT it wasnt amazing... There was nothing special about it, But the Mac n cheese was pretty good! I will give this place another try & hopefully next time will be better!

I only gave this place an extra star because the appetizer I had was awesome. Sadly, the service was terrible. I hope there is new management and servers that are actually attentive to the tables they serve... Can't forget about the wait time, with a nearly empty dining room.

The last time I was there was 2005. I don't eat beef and I'm at a steak house. But, let me tell you the Lamb Shank with the Lentils and Watercress was a delight! Oh, and please do start with the Crunchy Tuna Tacos. I missed Vegas! Service was great we had a party of 12. Those guys are PRO!

Ummm ...Riggghhhttt.  Alright, I'm into the ooo and ahhh as much as the next guy on the trendy strip spots.  I ended up again there this weekend, not my choise, and this has to be vented.  Trendy comfort food?  Bacon and Brie tater tots... mmm tastes like tater tots.. Pigs n' a blanket in a ketchup and mustard dipping sauce... ummm (what is the markup from Costco frozen food section I wonder).  Thin sliced beef on a hot rock ..(isn't that Korean BBQ?)  And don't look at me like I don't get it . Because I do!  I DO!   I just feel like somebody is laughing somewhere when the bill comes.  Positives... The steaks are actually very good.  Ok I feel better now.

The ambiance is nice and the food was pretty good but the service was lackluster. Our waiter had little personality. He was clearly not happy when we asked him to split the bill two ways even though we mentioned it when we ordered. Not a way to encourage us to come back.

Stack...

High priced steak, that was tasty, but not worth the money I paid for it.

My wife had the Petite Filet.  She said it was delicious.  I'm sure it was...it should have been for $38.

We did have an AWESOME oversized baked potato...that much I loved.

The service sucked...the ambience was nice, but typical of most of the other restaurants in Vegas...namely, dark.

I'd like to believe that there are a great deal of steak restaurants in Vegas where one could get a killer meal, for alot less...

But, it's a place to see, and be seen ( spending lots of money ), and I guess if that's what you're into, then it's the place for you.

I really wanted a great steak and a fantastic experience to go with it...

Ah well...next time.

Best steakhouse ever!!! I come here every time I am in Vegas and it never disappoints. The service is impeccable and the food even better :) my favorite items are the petite filet and mac n cheese! You MUST done here!!!

I know its always difficult to do a party of 18 at a steak house but so be it, its VEGAS!!! 
Made resey in advance, everyone but 2 arrived on time. We got seated pretty much not on time but all went well bc we checked-in and got a free in house shotx 18! Yay! Pumped up for the Boyz II Men concert!!!

We all ordered poop load of steak & sides & Tomahawk ribeye steak x10 and more sides & bottles of wine & cocktails....
1. Sides were good. Mushrooms were my fav. So yummy!!! 
2. King Crab Jalepeno tacos were tiny and ok, (thats what i remembered)
3. Dont order "Rare+" for steak bc you are NOT gona get what you ordered!!!!
Sadly, bone-in Tomahawk ribeye was too well done than ordered....and the server insisted differently. Too bad we were the one who ordered specific way and NOT got it that way. Steak should be made to order, right?? Very disappointed. Server just kept arguing back....*$$$ flying away*
Overall, service was slow bc it was a party of 18 but...yea, they failed!!!

Steak, fail!!! 
If it wasnt for the mushrooms, I would have flipped the table. Lol

Great dinner! We came here with a group of 6 and everyone really enjoyed themselves. Our waiter, Manny, was great from the start. He was very attentive and very thorough when it came to explaining the menu and talking us through stuff. The table shared the crab tacos for an appetizer and loved them. I ordered the butternut squash stuffed shells and they were amazing! The kale underneath was surprisingly delicious! 

They brought out 3 plates with desserts for three of the guests who were all celebrating birthdays this week. What a great touch and great hospitality! I couldn't speak anymore highly of their service and attentiveness. Great job!

This is my favorite restaurant in the world. And I am incredibly hard to please.
Their steaks are perfectly cooked (go for the petit filet), their sauces bring me to tears (the peppercorn is just crazy good), their fries are seasoned with crack, and their vegetables are just delicious. 
My wife doesn't like coming here with me because I make such a big deal out of it. She thought she married a man. Not a boy who weeps with each delicious bite. 
Their wine list is fantastic too. And their desert. Oh, and it's at the Mirage, which is great for some after-dinner blackjack. You can hear the excited casino cheering from the restaurant. 
Go here.

I went here for my 21st birthday and they make the absolutely best martinis...the pear one is AMAZING. The food is also awesome. I think it's more fun to come and order a few of their small things, such as the lobster tacos, brie and bacon tater tots, lettuce wraps, to just share with a large group. It was tons of fun to just get all the things and sample them all. I think its better for appetizers and what not rather then a full meal.

My only complaint was the service. When they neglected to bring us one of the things we order, we asked about it and still never received it. After we realized we had plenty of food we forgot about it. It was still on the bill and we reminded them kindly that it never came out and could they take it off the bill. Our waitress rudely stated that she would have to talk to her manager about it, and would let us know. what?????? Why would we pay for something we never received. Other then that the rest of our waiters were kind and very helpful!

The service was less than acceptable!  Waiter was rude and indifferent.   Service was slow.  The plan was to have a nice meal then go out and explore the casino.  We were stuck in that restaurant for over 3 hours and could not hear ourselves talk.  The music was way too loud for this type of restaurant so we could not converse.  Incredible disappointment.

I have come here on my last two trips to Vegas for one reason only-the 2LB LOBSTER STUFFED WITH RITZ CRACKERS AND CRABMEAT.

Seriously, enough said.

This restaurant was excellent! We had a party of 8 and we received great and timely service. I had the Sea Bass with risotto and it was phenomenal. Everyone at the table agreed that it was the best plate at the table. I would recommend this restaurant to anyone going to Vegas!

BEWARE: Wait staff tampers with receipts to give themselves larger tips!  

Had a lovely time here at dinner, however when I checked my credit card statement I noticed $25+ dollars were added to my total.  I tried to call to talk to the restaurant and they transferred me to their credit card dispute department, and I was on hold for 31 minutes during their stated business hours.  I never got to speak with anyone, but took a photo of my hold time total because I couldn't believe how long I was waiting and I wasn't confident anyone would ever pick up.  I decided to email them and I received an automated response that they would get back to me in 7-10 business days.  It is day 11, and I haven't received any response.  I finally had to dispute it with my credit card company.  I was shocked at the lack of response and unavailability of the credit card disputes department.  This type of thing has never happened to me before.  You would think management would take theft pretty seriously, but from the lack of response they seem ok with it.

Basically, I am saying - don't go here because someone on the wait staff steals.  If you go, make sure you pay cash.  I don't like writing bad reviews, but this type of behavior just isn't right and I felt the need to warn others to be careful.
Most delicious food and so worth it! Pear martini is so good! I had shrimp and the filet mignon and the garlic fries are so good too!
Absolutely love catching a bite to eat and having a #SparkPlug shot before starting my night

Great hidden gem within the Mirage. I work there and have never been to it.  Which now I regret because it was absolutely amazing. Great service, great food, and the ambience of the place is so modern and relaxing. We started off the night getting the lobster and rock appetizers. Which were off the charts beautifully presented and tasted wonderful.  The hot rocks app is a great way to start the dinner. Then we had the sea bass entree. Which was cooked so perfectly. Last we had the molten chocolate cake dessert. So rich and creamy! Wonderful food! I would defiantly recommend this place everything to family and friends.

I dined at Stack with a large group prior to heading to JET for a night out.  We had a couple of signature drinks (a bit pricey, but to be expected on the Strip) and ordered the chicken wings, along with the adult tater tots.  The chicken wings were delicious, I love that they are served "lollipop" style. This makes them very easy to eat and not messy at all.  I love tater tots of all kinds, but these were outrageously amazing! First of all, they are HUGE and there are chives (I believe) baked into the potato. Once you take a bite, warm cheese fills the center.  They were absolutely the best tater tots I have ever had.  I like the decor of the restaurant, it is covered in all wood paneling, but is way too similar to it's sister property, Fix at Bellagio.  The service is decent, nothing to write home about.  I recommend this place to everyone based off of the tots alone!

Stack is a classy restaurant  located inside the Mirage. I had heard the name before but it really wasn't on my radar if I'm being honest. The decor is fabulous consisting of perfect dim lighting with a curvy wood design on the walls. This place makes you feel like you're eating where the big name celebs would eat....it's top notch and fancy.  The service is excellent. Our server was knowledgeable, friendly and honest.  Since I am still in search of the best steak in Vegas I chose the Tomahawk rib eye and I had to try the Adult tater tots just for their name. I broke out into laughter when they brought the Tomahawk to the table because there was a foot long bone sticking out of the 18 oz rib eye ( the bone is about 6oz by itself). It was pretty amazing. The steak was melt in your mouth tender with every bite fully marbleized. Portion sizes were designed more for a welterweight than a heavyweight......Sugar Ray not Tyson. Ok...maybe I'm dating myself with that one. So, I left feeling comfortable,not stuffed. I definitely had room for dessert and that's a good thing. Stack is definitely on my radar now and it should be on everyone else's too.

While on vacation with my extended family, my sister and I became fed up with $25 slop buffets at Orleans and 6.99 eggs that tasted largely like, um, well, nothing.  So we spared my aunt and uncle the expense of taking us out to another meal that we probably wouldn't like and went to STACK instead.

STACK is a pretty strange place.  Not what you'd expect from the typical Vegas steakhouse.  The atmosphere is dark, very dark.  Interior design is modern and warm.  And the music.... oh the music.  Where else can you get a gigantic steak while listening to Prince and the Revolution (yeah, that's right, old school).  STACK is like a dance party waiting to happen, except you likely won't be able to move after you're done eating.

I'm a ribeye fan.  And let me tell you that the cowboy cut here was absolutely perfect.  Not only was it enormous (24 oz), but cooked to perfection.  And seasoned with little more than salt and pepper.

My sister ordered the kobe burger, and it too was amazing (I couldn't pass up a bite of a burger.... come on).  

But the single best thing we ate was the 'adult tator tots' stuffed with brie and bacon.  Perfect cylindrical potato morsels that just melt in your mouth.

If you're looking for a fun menu that doesn't go too over the edge, this is your place.  Unfortunately, like most Vegas restaurants, you can expect to pay for the quality.

this place is awesome.  absolutely loved it.  the atmosphere was great, the service was superb and the food was perfect!  we ordered a number of appetizers to share but my favorite was the tuna.  for my main course i had the porterhouse and this was cooked to absolute perfection.  it just melted in my mouth.  

i would recommend this place for a great steak in vegas.

This is mouthwatering good! and the prices were awesome for the Strip! I had the lettuce cups, 3 skewers of pork ,chicken and beef perfect! Then i had a cowboy steak, perfectly seasoned and cooked, melt in your mouth! Sides were mac and cheese, adult tater tots, baby veggies all rave reviews from my table. I could not stomach dessert i was stuffed beyond belief but i will be back to try dessert and happy hour!

Wow. We were standing outside looking at the menu, walked up to the hostess and asked for the menu just to tell us they were closed.  Walked up at 10:55pm and their schedule says they close at midnight.  I don't think it was meant to be. 3 stars because we didn't even try the food and yes I always give restaurants a chance.  But the fact that they didn't allow us to seat at 11:00pm ... B S

Everyone in our party agreed on our experience at Stack - really well prepared food; comfortable and classy ambience, and friendly service. We had the hot rocks, bone in filet and ribeye, seabass, mac and cheese, au gratin potatoes, ceasar salad, and mint chocolate dessert. Prices were a little higher than we expected (average $90 per person includes just one bottle of wine) but comparable to many Vegas restaurants. We would go back for sure.

This was our "big meal" for the Vegas trip (although we ate very well the entire time). The atmosphere is great - tiered wooden ceilings and a dark ambiance. I ordered the Tomahawk Rib eye ($62) and my wife ordered the tomato soup with grilled cheese and a Caesar salad (about $25). The steak was amazing! Incredible char with a bone that will interfere with those in close proximity. While we expected to pay quite a bit for the meal, we didn't count on a single Margarita being $25. A few things of note: the darkness makes it incredibly difficult to tell if your steak is done to your liking (I prefer medium, and mine was quite rare - thanks phone flashlight for coming to the rescue). Additionally, we wanted a little privacy and got a secluded booth in the back... Until they sat a party of 2 adults and 4 children (under 10) next to us. 
  In any case, it was a great meal. Expect to pay quite a bit (especially if you're drinking or like sides with your meal).

For $32 the burgers were not heavily. Salty! Make sure to take your blood pressure meds with you for this one. Double Yuck since my parents both ordered it. The adult tots were meh- take 'em or leave 'em. Mac n cheese was just ok. I really don't know what the hoopla is about. I ordered tomato soup with grilled cheese.  Kids,  yes this is not the restaurant for you. How could anyone ruin a grilled cheese?  I'm not sure, but Stacked managed to. I love all cheese. I'm a grilled cheese con a suer. If salt is their secret ingredient,  then it isn't a secret anymore. Don't be expected to be blown away. You'll spend alot$ just to be dieing of thirst in the middle of the night.  The service-  well, you can imagine- the waiter wasn't super excited to see a kid at his table.

Bar review only

The BF and I went here for a couple of drinks and a snack prior to seeing Love.  I got this cucumber martini type drink.  The garnish alone was so classy.  It was cherry tomatoes with cucumber.  The drink itself was so refreshing and good.  Too many times cucumber drinks just don't taste right - this one you could really taste the cucumber in it and it didn't taste artificial either.  We also got the crunchy fries with the truffle and Parmesan dipping sauce.  These were cooked perfectly - crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside.  The sauce was so good too - though I am sometimes partial to truffle oil - it just tastes so good!  Definitely a good place to grab a quick drink.

If you happen to have superhuman mutant night vision and an affinity for good steaks, then this is the place for you.  My filet mignon was DELISH, problem was I couldn't see it.  The place was completely dark save for a few candles and by the end of my spring mix salad (which was fresh and yummy), I was secretly wishing for a Paris Hilton cam just so I would be able to see what I was eating.  Additionally they crank up the music so loud you have to basically shout at your dinner companions.  

The food was good - the steak sauces that came with the filet were amazing and the seabass was fresh and tasty and perfect.  The presentation of the food, what I saw of it at least - assisted with cell phone lighting, was pretty.

There were some damn fine waiters walking around, but the service SUCKED.  This place operates similar to a club, where all attention is directed to the cash money millionaires and the wads of paper flowing out of their Prada suits - homeboy at the adjacent table was practically having his feet licked by the wait staff.  Our waiter disappeared after our food was served and a busser served us dessert without spoons which took a good 10 minutes for them to correct, and by that time the ice cream had melted.

STACK: very trendy place with great food and sucky service.
I love stopping here for a few beers. The burgers are very good. I recommend stopping here for a beer before a show at the Mirage.

Im trying to gather my memory here, but, unfortunately, when we ate at STACK, it was at the end of a week long business trade show and a half dozen cocktails. It's sketchy BUT:

I split a 46 oz steak with my coworker.

I had gourmet donut holes (holy hell were they good).

The waiters fold your napkin when you get up to go the bathroom. 

Food is great, interior is beautiful, expensive as hell. That about wraps it up. Everything I'd expect from Vegas.

Great food! The prices seemed to have gone up as they're trying to improve the quality of food and service to get in line with places like STK, Prime, and Craftsteak.

The ambiance is really cool...good tunes for an elevated volume and pretty staff/clientele. This is a nice place for a fun date or group because they have plenty of room for larger parties.

I took a bachelor party of 14 and made reservations about two weeks ahead of time, however, we had to wait for about 10 minutes before being seated and then were short two seats. The staff quickly fixed the error and we were comfortably seated.

The service was quite a bit slower than I expected, as our drink orders weren't taken until about 10 minutes after we had been given menus. Our drinks didn't come until about 1 minute before our entrees, which were delivered quickly and fresh.

I had the petit filet and it was wonderful...ruby red center and deliciously flavored. We had the adult tater tots and macaroni which were fresh and fantastic as well. I tried a bite of the Seabass and it's amazing, I'd definitely recommend that if you aren't a steak person.

I recommend a bit of expediency to the restaurant when it comes to a large group of gentlemen who are eager to make toasts, and get the drink orders and deliver them faster.

I really hope to return and have a better experience...the three star review is mostly due to the latency of service. Again, the food is fantastic.

My husband and I ate a late dinner here last Sunday. The service was great and the drinks were even better ! I liked that the drink / dessert menu was on an iPad . We ordered surf and turf with Mac n cheese and asparagus . My husband orders the Root if Sin cocktail which was their soon on a mojito, I ordered a Cadillac margarita complete with an airplane bottle of grand marnier :) for dessert we ordered a scoop of vanilla ice cream as well as the creme brûlée which were both AMAZING ! Will definitely be visiting again on our next Vegas trip

Rob and Heidi are my servers and they are Awesome! 6 out of five stars for sure. The 10 oz. flat iron was so good and the service was great. Not to mention the architecture in the restaurant was really cool. I recommend this place if you go to Vegas regardless of if you are staying in Mirage or not

Would give zero stars if I could. The service was downright horrible. Prices were astronomically high. Salmon that was claimed to be fresh caught was more like farmed and frozen. Music was ridiculously loud.  Not a good experience and won't be going back.
Edited to add:  My father in law asked for a frozen margarita and they said they didn't have a blender!!!  Omg!! What? They have a bar. No blender?

Went here with a group of 8 on a Friday evening. We were seated right away although they did not have a record of our reservation.   All entrées were served in hearty portions. I had the Tomahawk steak.  Good size.  Asked for it to be cooked to medium...closer to medium rare.

We've been trying to get here for 6 months and finally late last night made it.  Was it worth the wait? Yes.  for the atmosphere alone.  dark & clubby.  The cavernous effect does have a downside, however.  Noise. We knew the table 3 rows away was from St. Louis just from being able to hear their convo.  

Lets first say that we are not 20somethings living on mommy & daddy's dime and don't go places to be seen which is the vibe we both got from here.  I understand the Light group marketing concept which is have a bunch of hot chicks around and the men with money will show up.  Gotcha.  Makes for great people watching too.  

Anyway, we just wanted to have some tapas like appetizers so we had the bacon/brie adult tater tots -- perfect except we needed 2 orders of them since we were fighting over the 3rd one.  Parm/chicken pops.  melt in the mouth delicious. And the main reason we went, the cooked on the hot rocks thin marinated stacked steaks.  Yum.  

As our "main" course we had grilled cheese and tomato soup.  equally yum.  

So why only 3 *** if the food was good.  

The service is terrible.  Even with reservations we had to wait 20 minutes.  There is no separate area for the ongoing bachelorette party of 8 giggle girls at 1 table and 6 at another.  

Once seated, we became invisible to the point where my dinner companion had to go hunt down someone to take our drink order after waiting at the table another 30 minutes.  If the 4 guys at the table next to us hadn't been so enthralling amusing trying to pick up at least 1 of the girls from table #2 of swingles, you can bet we'd of left.  

The over all time from arrival to check signing was 1.9 hours.  For simple tapas & soup..way too long.  Even on a holiday weekend.  Coupled with the fact that 3 tables seated after us were gone by the time our main course came, didn't help my mood.  

We even accounted for the fact that it was a holiday weekend and apparently since the economic downturn, Vegas waitstaff has lost it's ability to hustle.  

We will try it again if for nothing else the tater tots and hot rock steak alone.  But we'll also make sure we have a book or at the iPad to keep us entertained.
Nice enough place. The wife found a happy hour deal on their website which they wouldn't honor. $20 cocktails were ok but not worth it.

I have never been to a steak house or any fancy restaurant in Vegas that sometimes I forgot these beautiful places exist in these hotels! I'm so used to going to buffets or eating at hole-in-the-wall spots. Came here for dinner for my cousin's bachelorette with a party of 9 girls. The lighting and ambience of this place was beautiful and definitely was fitted for a fancy dinner. The price of the drinks were like any high-end restaurant starting at about $14 for the cheapest cabernet wine to anything higher than that. The steak prices were pretty up there too, ranging from almost to about $100+, only for the best and delicacy ones. 

I ordered the hot rocks, which consists of 5 pieces of brisket that you cook on a hot rock. It is kind of like the concept of korean bbq, but a little bit more fancier. That meal costed $21 and was not fulfilling at all, but enough to eat something before a night of drinking and not feeling too full. Also ordered a side of broccolini which is enough to share with someone and I think that was around $12-14. I would definitely come back for a date night!

Dinner was delicious. Service was fantastic. Our entrees ranged from sea bass to filet mignon. We had Kale salad which was enough to serve three and we also had asparagus (hollandaise was to die for) and the twice baked potato which was incredibly generous. Our servers, Rob and Trevor were attentive and extremely helpful.  Highly recommend it!  Thanks for a great evening.
went in summer of '07, all american favorites in a hip setting, remember the food being spectacular, however that was almost 2 years ago!

Went here after the Terry Fator show which by the way is fabulous!!! Not too hungry so ordered appetizers. The roasted tomato soup was delish..comes with mini grilled cheese sandwiches. Great comfort food. 
Also had the short rib meatballs which were really good. Will definitely come back on our next trip and try the steak.
Went here after the Boys to Men concert. Great late night find. Had Apps only. Wings, Shrimp, and meatballs. ok Wine list. A bit loud. Service was excellent

Came here for dinner with a large group. I'm always disappointed when restaurants don't provide separate checks. So at the end of dinner, trying to determine how much each person owed was a nightmare.

The menu is a bit pricey but the food provided is great quality. I ordered the sea bass with risotto. Because we were sharing, the kitchen split the plate into two for us. 

I tried a few of the other dishes and I was pretty impressed. The kobe beef burger was pretty good. I would definitely want to order that next time I come visit.

It's a pretty classy place and the ambiance is super sexy. A nice place to fall in love. ;)

Here is a tip: it's cheaper to pay for a bottle of wine versus ordering cocktails. Also, if you check in on Yelp you can get a free shot.

My entire experience at Stack was AMAZING! From the time I called to make a reservation to the time we left! We were greeted by 3 wonderful hosts, our waiter Charlie was absolutely AMAZING! He checked on us a perfect number of times! Our glasses stayed filled and our food came out in no time! This was the best dining experience I have had thus far! Will definitely eat here again if I'm ever in Vegas!

We came here simply because we'd been eating like royalty the two nights prior, had a full day of vegas-ing, took a long time to get ready for our 3rd night out, had tickets to LOVE and didn't really have any preference on where we ate this night since our main focus was the show. We narrowed it down to somewhere in the mirage to help save time and this sounded the best to our husbands. Even upon our first step inside we were plesantly surprised. Very cool vibe and decor. Excellent reception, friendly attentive service from the very get go. The place was totally packed, loud but not annoyingly so. We had a few appetizers and it's been too long to remember all the details but they were all good. I remember nothing was healthy - but whatever we were celelbrating. The steaks were good, sauces yummy and drinks were strong. We had a very lovely evening which was cool because we honestly didn't have high, or even medium expectations for the place. Then a week later we got a hand written thank you note in the mail thanking us for our business. Very nice touch and nice way to bring back a reminder of a fun little weekend trip to vegas. If it was just a few percent cheaper I think it'd be perfect. We'd eaten and MIX the night before which is extremely elegant and amazing and no offense to STACK -but way out of their league and our bills were almost the same. But, that's vegas so we also weren't surprised. If I ever find myself back in the mirage

Looks small from the outside, yet very accommodating for any size party. Our filet melted in our mouth! Fabulous ambience, even nice for private evenings and yet I would still bring my children in there for a nice dinner. Cesar salad was excellent! The red velvet lava cake was *****, absolutely five stars! =) loved it.

Swanky room and great service. Food shakes out as follows:

Caesar salad: 4 stars
Porterhouse for 2: 5 stars
Mashed potatoes: 4.5 stars (yummy but stingy portion)
Coffee: 3 stars

Everything was great until the "fresh pot we just brewed." Class operation should have class coffee. Still a great evening and a highly recommended place to have dinner at the Mirage.

No joke. This is by far the best steak house I've been to since I've been in Vegas. Amazing. Came in for my husband's birthday, we ordered a few cocktails and a small stack seafood appetizer share between the two of us, everything tasted so fresh and the dipping sauces provided complimented it all well.

We both chose steak as an entree and we were both equally impressed. Our filets melted in our mouth like butter - cliche to say but so true.

Don't expect to walk out of here under $100 with a full belly and satisfied pallet. It's definitely pricey but so worth it.


Atmosphere is really nice, maybe we're getting old but the music was super loud. Definitely didn't match the decor.

I'll be having the hubby bring me back for date night :)

I feel like the Light Group gets their crowds in here as part of the Bachelorette package, otherwise why would anyone go here? haha...anyway...so yes, we were surrounded by loud, obnoxious girls, mostly in tiny dresses, and lots of ladies with veils on their head...ayiyi

Party of 4.  Apparently before Eric R. and I got here, our party (his relatives) had to argue with management for 20 minutes to get a round table in the middle of the restaurant (reserved for parties of 6 or more I guess?) - we didn't want a corner tiny table and we needed the round table for the food we got, glad that worked out.

Too many servers...the waiter who took our appetizers was not the one who took entree orders.  Confusing!  We got hot rock with sirloin (barely any meat for the cost, tasty but not worth it), tuna tartare (good), Asian lettuce wraps (these come with pork, beef, and chicken skewers. None of us eat pork.  We asked for a sub.  Waiter says "We cannot compromise on this - no subs" - how hard is it to give us chicken skewer instead of pork?  We asked them to leave it off and they wouldn't hahahah)

Drinks - I got a bellini...yummy.  Pellegrino for half table, flat water for other.  Glad I wasn't paying! We asked 2nd waiter for side of onion rings to be an appetizer.  Instead of agreeing and doing so, he goes and looks for first waiter, comes back and tells us we did not order onion rings as appetizer with first waiter...uh duh, we just did with you.  So he asks if we are sure...yes we are...oy!!

Eric's relatives ordered the 40 oz steak for 2 and asked for spinach instead of 2nd mashed potatoes...that did not get computed and they got 2 potatoes, 2 spinaches....Eric ordered Brooklyn filet with scampi - asked for it medium, got it rare.  Had to send back but it was better the 2nd time.

I got small shellfish stack - small lobster tail (gave to Eric), big crab legs that came out of shell nicely, 4 oysters, 2 tiger prawns, baby tabasco sauce, mignonette, on ice...pretty good and filling, nice presentation.  We were too full for dessert.

Overall, relatively okay service but a little flighty and bizarre on the ordering, food was okay, atmosphere was too loud and too bachelorette-y, and I don't see a reason to return.  However, the food was tasty enough for 3 stars.

This one is a tough one to rate.  On one hand, the food is very good (not the best I've ever had but very good), the decor is REALLY cool,  and the hostesses were exceptional (and no, I'm not just talking about looks....but, they are pretty dang foxy).  On the other hand, the music is waaaaay too loud, the prices are absolutely outrageous, and the servers, while professional, were not all that friendly (seemed rushed and somewhat frantic even though the restaurant wasn't full).

I hosted a business dinner, part of ten, we had no real complaints, but when you're laying out that kind of cash, you want the service and atmosphere to be through the roof awesome, and therefore, only four stars.

Hoping tor a great experience and was completely let down. Loved the decor/style but the food was "just ok" and WAY overpriced. Service was spotty and seating was cramped.

There are much, much better choices for a fine dining experience within the hotel. Avoid.

I should have known better when I booked a reservation for 4 the night before and had my choice of times.

I am hard to please when it comes to steak, what I can say I just have never really been a fan until now. I love the steak at Stack's!!!
MGM has hit the mark with this restaurant- It's sexy, modern, and very stylish.  For those of you that bitch about the prices- get over it, its Vegas. Plus you get what you paid for and it's good!  We have tried the NYC Sirloin, whipped potatoes, adult tator tots, and onion rings and loved it all. I can't wait to go back and try the pigs in a blanket.

The was my second meal in Vegas. The price point for this Restaurant is more than I originally thought after looking at the stats on here. 

The service was ok. We had three waiters, but some how drinks were not brought to the table until after dinner. When one of the girls told him they no longer wanted the drink because we were leaving dinner he still brought it out and charged us for it. LARGE GROUPS BEWARE they will NOT SPLIT CHECKS, which is a little awkward for the end of dinner when everyone has to pool together to pay. 

The food was alright. Not bad but not great. Two of the girls had to send back their steaks because they were WAY over cooked. It took the entire rest of the meal to get them back (they wanted rare steaks). And like I said for the price you are paying for these steaks they should be done correctly. The veggies were overcooked and not all that enjoyable. The Adult tater tots, mack and cheese, and mashed potatoes were good (they have the carbs down). 
Find another steak house if you want steak, I would even venture to say Ruth's Chris Steak out in Charlotte has better steaks.
Aside from the terrible coffee, everything else was pretty decent.  The manager hooked me up with a seat on new years eve.  I saw Kid Rock there -- I think he was scheduled to hang at Jet that night.

My friends and I had an awesome meal here while playing for the weekend in Vegas. The atmosphere is trendy, and the music was loud but good. The appetizers were amazing, with lots of cool bites to share. My buddy had the steak fillet, which he said was one of the best in town. I had the chicken, very juicy and tender. The side of Mac cheese and the cheesy potatoes were awesome. Manager was friendly and very accommodating.

I enjoyed a nice dinner here with colleagues while in town for CES. The restaurant offers a variety of steaks as well as new American fare. Although I didn't get the opportunity to sample any appetizers, my sea bass with risotto was excellent - the bass was seared perfectly, and the risotto was flavorful and creamy. My sautéed spinach side dish was good, and my coworkers all seemed to enjoy their meals as well. Though I didn't particularly care for any of the desserts on the menu, my server was able to whip up a nice affogato for me. 
Service was friendly and attentive, doing a good job of keeping water glasses full and responding to requests. Overall, this place is a good option if you're looking to have a standard upscale dinner

I honestly can't say enough about the amazing meal we just had here. Not only was the food amazing, the service we received from Vince was out of this world. We had reservations for 8:30 pm and show tickets for 10:00 pm. With a packed restaurant and us eating desert we still walked out at 9;40 pm. I highly recommend the restaurant and please do yourself a favor and request Vince!

i was dissapointed when we first sat down at our table and found the menu online was not the same as the current menu.  in addition to several of the seafood items being cut there was only one pasta on the menu instead of two which gave my vegetarian friend almost no options.  the caesar salad is not worth ordering and the side of mashed potatoes were so-so, not very flavorful.  i really liked the kobe burger but that was about the only good thing about the place.  our food came out in about 8 minutes and we felt rushed through the whole meal.

I thought it was excellent all the way around the drinks the food the service.  We presented the free shot offer  on yelp, my phone was ruined at the previous days pool party lol he gave me a free one anyway. Our waiter talked with us about the celebrity sightings and it was just great !!!!!!!!!!

The food is probably good but the service is something else!! We were there last night just to hang out before the boyz II men concert but we were thrown off guard when we decided to just order appetizers and drinks...the waitress was like, that's it?!...what kind of establishment questions patrons what they order when we are there to be served not to be sized up for a tip?!no star is deserved

I love the little wings here and the hot rocks and the pigs in a blanket. The seafood platter is amazing. We were there on a Friday and the live Dj added to the atmosphere. This is a good time for a group of girls looking to have fun in Vegas. I'll definitely be back!

I made reservation at this steak house because it was my son's bday and I wanted him to experience fine dining .When we arrived to the restaurant the hostess was very rude.  We were staying at the Mirage. We are VIP guests at the hotel.  We got to the lobby a bit early so we decided to get a drink at the bar. We asked the bartender if we are allowed to take our drinks to the restaurant and he said yes, for sure. The hostess at the restaurant rudely asked for our drinks .
We stepped out of the restaurant to finish the drinks and went back to the hostess desk. She again asked  to have our glasses in a unfriendly approach. I was with my husband and 10 year old son. It took time for the waiter to come to the table. The waiters and bus boys were running back and forth without attending to us for about 10 minutes. The atmosphere made us uptight instead of feeling a relaxed
atmosphere. 
We asked for bread and the only bread was with ham. We don't eat pork , So we passed. Then I started by ordering the Mac and cheese for my son and that too had ham.  The waiter said that he can whip up some pasta and butter for him. I ordered chicken and my husband ordered an Cesar's salad and a couple of appetizers. my husband asked to speak with the mgr. We explained the situation and experience we are having. He understood and apologized and asked if he can get us some plain bread from the other restaurant, and we said yes. The mgr said he was going to comp my glass of wine, I thanked him. The check arrived,i review'd the charges, they comped the drink and the two appetizers, (which I thought was very nice considering the experience). I saw they charged $33.00 for the pasta. That was suppose to replace the Mac and cheese at $14.00 and I questioned that with the waiter and he snapped at me and said "we comped your appetizers". So what that meant is they needed to make it up with an overcharge on the small plate of pasta and butter. I paid cash and will NEVER go back to the place to eat again. We were very disappointed .. 
FYI , it was my sons Birthday and I made everyone aware. The waiter didn't acknowledge him in anyway, which is soo unprofessional. I will spend my money elsewhere where they appreciate the customers.

I think Stack and Fix have very similar menus, and my dining experiences were very similar at both restaurants. Both restaurants have that dark yellow, almost orange glow to them. I do like the decor of both as well. We had a 9:00pm reservation, and the restaurant seemed about half full. 

For appetizers, we shared the miso cod lettuce cups and the lobster tacos. The lobster tacos were so cute...I almost didn't want to eat them, but I soon got over that! I got the kurbota pork chop and hubby got a steak. The pork chop was amazing! My husband thought the same as well. The adult tater tots were also very good. 

To end our evening we had the jelly doughnut munchin holes, and boy were these so good! I wasn't even hungry and I kept eating until they were all gone! 

I will up my rating to 4.5 stars because the food was spectacular and hit the spot!
Tried a trifecta of the adult tater tots, mini-gyros, and short rib meatballs.  Each was perfection. Those taters...

Food was amazing! I got the butternut squash ravioli I and it was one of the tastiest meals I had in a long time. My partner got the Kobe beef burger and he said it was the best he has ever had. The place is elegant and very modern. I'd go back for another meal!

Beautiful restaurant, courteous and friendly staff (the hostess was on point). Delicious food, with a menu that makes you want to try everything. I was pleased to go with the recommendations of our server, Charles. He was definitely on top of his game tonight, going above and beyond for us during the entire experience. 

Definitely get the short ribs, and the Hot Rocks! That appetizer was fun and delicious. The meat melted in my mouth.  
A++

There were so many good things on the menu we ordered about 5 for the table and shared.  The adult tater tots were "Ok" ... was expecting more cheese.  Lettuce Cups "Ok" ... more flavor at CPK.  And would have like a heads up that our servers changed in the duration of our meal.  HOWEVER, def. order the pigs in a blanket (yes, really),  Prosciutto, Truffle-Parmesan Pasta was just as rich as it sounds. And a friend really enjoyed the lamb dinner.  If we had room, we would have ordered more and dessert!  Nice ambiance.  Good for large groups, small or couples.

Had a great dining experience at Stack. Ordered a melon mojoto to start things off. For appetizers we got the hot rock and the king Alaskan crab tacos. Our entree was the bone in filet with a side of the adult taitor tots. Dessert was the chocolate molten cake and jelly donut holes. Amazing dinner, good service with a contemporary decor. Hope to come back soon.

Ordered the small steak appetizer and Mac and cheese. 

Mac and cheese was delicious. The steak appetizer was not very good. You cook them on some rocks but the meat would stick to the Rock and would not come off. 

Other than that cocktails were made very well but not sure I would recommend to a friend.

Last Night my girlfriends and I had one of the greatest meals ever!

This was out first stop before our night out of Love show and then off to 1OAK!

Wow what an amazing meal.. Service ++++++,  Taste +++++++ Specialty Drink choices and oh there are many very unique ones.

You gotta have the HOT ROCKS 
Ambiance is awesome, and the vibe is really really cool.

Awesome experience at Stack.

Went for dinner on a Saturday night. Made a reservation and only had to wait about 15 minutes. We ordered a bunch of small plates to share, including the lamb gyros, asparagus with truffle sauce, rock shrimp, tater tots and the rock steak. Both that tater tots and rock steak were identified as most popular items but I actually thought they were overrated. Everything else was delicious and they have some fantastic cocktails!

Overall great experience, really good service and loved the in-house dj spinning some tunes that got me in the mood for Saturday night!

I have now taken 3 different groups of customers here and each time, the food, the atmosphere and the entire experience was fantastic!
I would highly recommend starting with the "hot rocks" appetizer and after that - just go with what looks good - you can NOT go wrong :)

I was curious to check out this place because it was shown on a couple of episodes of Keeping up with the Kardashians). Since I live here in town I decided to come here with my wife for Mothers Day. The atmosphere was very lively and nightclub music! Our server was very friendly and conversational. We ordered the Brooklyn Filet and a side order of the asparagus and the adult tots.. Those tots were bomb!  The steak was ok but expected a little but more flavor.. The asparagus could've been a little bit more better as well! Again, the service was great, atmosphere was great but the food and the dessert was good but its nothing "special".

Have to say, I've been here many times, but last night was my last time.  Service was extremely slow, even though we had two waiters, they forgot two of the ordered items, when they finally came out they were cold, had to flag someone down for refills on water and tea multiple times, and the food was mediocre at best.  But to top it all off, the waiter never returned my credit card.  My fault for not noticing right away, but we were in a hurry to get to the show.  I noticed later that evening and I had to call and cancel my card.

Got seated right away without a reservation and the place was pretty full. The restaurant is very sexy actually if a restaurant can be sexy - the lighting is cool red and orange and dark, the decor is very nice and the curves in the ceiling, lighting and walkways make it very cool. 

The menu looked absolutely amazing - so many items that really intrigued me it was mouthwatering !!! Should of come here sooner 

BUT WOW - I guess I should have looked at the photos on YELP before I ordered the KOBE Burger...I actually wanted to order a steak, but they were all a little too big.....In retrospect maybe not ha ha. 

Ordered a nice Melbac and the service was impeccable. The hamburger was really good but a little too rare even for me. The fries were likely some of the best I've ever had - and super hot !! 

LOVE the Stack !

Love the ambiance here amongst the Vegas chaos. The service is consistent and detail oriented. The cuisine is American Artisan. I've experience this restaurant three times and have experienced an array of the menu. My favs..adult tater tots.. Yum the butternut squash stuffed shells, the Kobe beef burger and of course the steak! All so good! The drinks are pleasing to the eye but don't expect to get tipsy. Kyle was my waiter twice and he's fun and really helped me pull off a Bday surprise! Side note if you been to STK... It kinda has that view w/o the DJ.

I'm probably rating this a little short.  But I normally reserve 5 stars for the complete surprises.  But Stack did really deliver on all levels.  The design was interesting yet somewhat romantic.  The DJ made it a little loud but unless that sort of thing bothers you it was fine.  Service was top notch and very attentive.  They even responded well to an oddity.  I was hit in the head by flying glass.  I think a drunken cowgirl (hey, it's rodeo week) at the next table over couldn't handle her cocktail.  The staff from bussers to manager changed out all our drinks and cleaned the glass around our table swiftly.  Nice response by all.  We had the pigs in a blanket for an app.  Nothing fancy but just the right size and surprisingly tasty.  The sea bass with lobster risotto and shellfish broth was excellent according to my better half.  I'm not a fish guy but had a taste and it was very good.  I hit up the special which was Bbq spare ribs with potato salad, okra, and corn bread.  Fell completely off the bone.  Excellent smokey flavor.  So good I didn't even want to use any of the extra bbq sauce provided.  But it was quite good in its own right.  Forced ourselves to split a dessert and glad we did.  Had the raspberry donut holes with vanilla sauce.  So good and a nice sweet finish to such a savory meal.  Not a cheap meal but hey, you're paying for the quality and service and they make it worth it.  There will definitely be return visits in my future.

Our group ended up doing the Prix Fix menu which was definitely worth it.  It is pricey but not unusual for Vegas.  Their appetizers were to fantastic.  The lobster tacos were great and made you want more.  The sizzling hot rocks were so good and on the fun side to eat.  The steak was made perfectly and was delicious.  Definitely use the wine sauces provided.  The chicken was on the saltier side, but not too shabby.  Their mint ice cream brownie dessert was delicious and different.  Instead of the artificial mint taste it had more of a mint taste that was similar to Thai basil.  Ambiance was typical for a steakhouse - easy to have a conversation and intimate.  Would definitely try again.
The steak. Indescribable. Absolutely perfect. Get the mushrooms too. Good wine, great service. Cucumber mojito is smooth too.

I've been to Stack 3 times: 2007, 2009, & just last week (2012). I would consider the place is 'fine dining' because of the atmosphere, casino location, prices, & dining style. Food has wonderful taste, great service, & nice clean vibes. Calamari is crunchy. Buffalo chicken is okay. Jalapeno king crab tacos taste fresh. Hot rocks are tasty and fun. The stack burger is juicy and filling. Appetizers are very small portions but hey, they're appetizers & fancy places are always small portions. I recommend sharing a couple appetizers. I'll definitely be back! Come thirsty, looking pretty, & you got a nice date!

I've been here twice now before Love shows and thought the food was great both times. Most recently, my date and I had the porterhouse steak for two ($105 for 40oz) which was tender and cooked to perfection, with great flavoring.  The steak for two also came with whipped potatoes, delicious.

We ordered the jalapeno crab tacos ($24 for four tiny little tacos) to start.  They were alright but I'd probably skip them if I ever dined here again, the meat and potatoes were more than enough food. The signature cocktails are about $20 each, which just sounds ridiculous. I'd skip that too.

The service was good, though I find the vibe to be douchey and the prices are just a little more than I feel bliss about spending.

The food here is absolutely amazing!! Everything here is delicious from the bread to the lamb! Apparently you have to ask for bread (they don't bring it out even for dinner like many restaurants do).
