From the outside It didn't seem very crowded and it looked very modern inside (very aesthetically pleasing), so my gf and I decided to get a bite to eat there. The nice lady hostess seated us to our table and I really liked the ambience. There was a bachelorette party taking place near the main bar and they didn't seem too crazy. :)

I liked that the house/trance music was not too loud and it had a rich and immense clarity of sound, that an audiophile would appreciate! Maybe similar to Bowers & Wilkins speakers. I never had to yell or text to communicate with my gf; the volume was just right!

We weren't too hungry, nor did we want to take left overs, so we opted for the "signature small plates". My gf ordered Miso Habachi Skewers and I ordered the Mini Lamb Gyros and they were both amazing! There were small portioned, although they seemed like the perfect amount for us at that time. My gf's small plate came with a little hot grill to keep the meat warm on the skewers and it also had a rich peanut butter sauce; quite tasty! My mini gyros came in a little platter with a creamy cucumber yogurt sauce and they were to die for! I enjoyed that it was like perfect temperature; not too hot or cold, just right! 

My gf ordered a dessert (warm chocolate cake) and it came with vanilla ice cream and a chocolate stick on the side. I had a taste and I believe this was the best chocolate lava cake I ever had! It melts in your mouth! On top of the ice cream there was a white round coin-shaped piece, depicting red letters "STACK". We thought it was plastic and to make sure we took a bite and it turned out that it was white chocolate.

The only aspect of our dinner, that I was not fond of, was our first waiter. He seemed a little cocky and seemed didn't want to be there. Good thing that we had the pleasure of a new courteous waiter after we received our entrées. I think he had short blonde hair but anyway, he was great and it make our night more enjoyable!

I highly recommend this restaurant/bar at the Mirage!

came here for a group dinner, and all the courses were pre-ordered.  the waiter was kind to bring out a vegetarian appetizer being all the appetizers were meat oriented.

i had the truffled pasta dish sans pancetta, and it was rich and delectable.  the rest of the party enjoyed their entrees, and loved the appetizers.  

the staff is on point and seriously attentive.  one of the gals dropped her utensil, and in a blink of an eye a server was there to replace it.

I really like this place.  It is inside the Mirage and has a great ambiance, awesome choices (especially if you have a kid at heart aka picky eater with you) and good food.  A few favorites include:  bacon and brie tator tots (enough said right?), ahi, asparagus and just old fashioned fun would mean ordering the pigs in a blanket.  Overall everything I have had is good to great.  I've tried so many things that reviewing them is tough because I honestly I have enjoyed it all.  I feel like it is a place you can actually go and walk out without having paid an arm and a leg.  Prices are fair for the quality.  I highly recommend this spot!
Delicious and worth every penny. Great service and all a round great experience. A must try is the surf n turf. Will feed 2 with some for later. It was so worth my money.

Stack was one of the better decisions I made while in Vegas with some friends from college. 

My only job for the Vegas planning was finding a good restaurant for our group to visit without breaking the bank. I can very confidently say mission accomplished on that front.

Number one, I might have changed our reservation time 3 times on open table the day we were going to Stack and it didn't seem to be a problem at all. We got the Mirage and walked straight to the restaurant. After talking to the hostess, we probably waited for five minutes while they set our table for 8. 

First things first: I loved the atmosphere of this place as soon as we walked in. It was classy and dimly lit, but not TOO dimly lit. It just seemed like a cool place to be when having a nice dinner. ALSO, we got a round table for our party of 8 which I was extremely happy with. I'm not a big fan of having people at opposite ends of a rectangular table and this huge round table they sat us at let everyone talk with each other during dinner. BIG plus. 

Second: If you come here make sure to check in on Yelp! We got 8 free shots just for checking in. (Granted they were pink and tasted like lemonade, but what can you expect?) 

Third: The food. was. fantastic. I was a little nervous when we walked in and it wasn't busy at all but that might be because we were in Vegas and having dinner at 6:30 pm.... Anyway. That didn't end up being a problem. The Caesar salad was one of the best I've ever had - crispy and fresh lettuce, well dressed. The sides we all got to split were also excellent - the adult tater tots and the mac and cheese. We got two of each and there was a little bit left over for 8 of us. Most of us went with the filet mignon for our entree and we were rewarded for our choice. My steak was cooked a perfect medium rare and the compote butter on top added a ton of flavor to each bite. I got my filet with the shrimp scampi and they were done very well. 

All in all it was just a great experience. The service was prompt, polite, and helpful. I'd recommend Stack to anyone who is staying near the Mirage as it is worth your time and money.

My wife and I tried Stack for a special occasion on a trip to Las Vegas.  Most of the luxury hotels have their own steak restaurants, and I can't comment on those as I didn't try them.

Both the wife and I tried the filet mignon and mashed potatoes.  Additionally I had a cocktail with my meal.  As stated in other reviews, everything is ordered a la carte.  

The ambiance of the restaurant was fancy, though it was very dark as some have mentioned.  I didn't mind this, as tables are fairly close to one another and the darkness helps give a more private feel than could be achieved with more light given the tables proximity to one another. 

Service was top notch.  Drinks were refilled quickly, food brought out promptly, and everyone was professional and friendly.

We both agreed that the steak was cooked perfectly.  Both steaks were extremely tender and flavorful.  We both order the steaks cooked medium and they came as expected with a warm, just slightly brown center.  Neither of us have had the opportunity to go to a lot of high end steak houses, but I have been to a couple, and this was in my opinion the best steak I have had. The mashed potatoes were also very good.  My wife is a huge starch fan and deemed them the best mashed potatoes she has ever had.

The cocktail was a Long Island Iced Tea.  I am not a wine fan, which I am sure if you had the taste for it would have accompanied this meal nicely, but the cocktail was very well done and obviously made with premium liquors.

All and all this place was great for a special occasion.  Prices reflect the service and quality of the food.  Don't go if you aren't willing to let yourself forget about the check for the night.  I don't see myself going back to Las Vegas anytime soon, but I would definitely go back if I found myself in the area.

We got a pre dinner meal before our circ de soliel show. The dinner tickets were $49 per person which didn't include drinks,  tax or gratuity...okay fine. But then we were brought the pre show menu which only included soup or salad, a pasta, chicken or skirt steak. No side dish. And desert was miniature Eskimo pies (3) on a toothpick or donut holes. The cheapest glass of wine was $17. Not even close to worth the price. Wouldn't recommend.

I wish I could give different ratings for different levels of feelings I have for this place. If I could break it down, I'd give 1-1/2 stars for service and 4-1/2 for food, so I guess three stars is the best I can do.

Really, REALLY surprised that this place is as big of a hot mess as it is, considering it's not new. It's been around for a while, but you'd think it was the newest hottest restaurant on the strip - and without giving its staff proper training. The reason I'm complaining about this first and foremost is because I was here during CES - the Consumer Electronics Show - which is in Las Vegas every year. So, one would think the staff and management would be aware of this ~little annual trade show that brings in more than 100,000 people.

First off - hostess. Wow, attitude much? Honey, if you can't handle all these guests in your restaurant with grace and aplomb, might I suggest another line of part-time work? And, blaming everything from being over-booked to OpenTable is NOT the way to make sure your potential guests feel good about choosing Stack over the other amazing restaurants in Vegas. I don't know, maybe talk to the manager of comping drinks for those of us who had reservations weeks ago...or something to make us feel welcome and that you're truly sorry about the craziness of the restaurant that night. But, that's just me...

We finally - FINALLY - got seated after an hour-long wait...with no one checking to see if we're okay or wanted anything to snack on while waiting or even complimentary drinks. And nary an apology was in sight. That's just f**ked up. 

So, after getting seated, it took forever to get a waiter over to get our menus and drink orders. What was really confusing is that one waiter came over and gave us his name and the name of this "team" that would be serving us that night...then the head guy (or who I assumed was our lead waiter since he came up to us and introduced himself) disappeared. Yeah...completely. Some other guy, who did NOT seem like a happy camper was helping us...and I'm using the term "help" loosely here. 

Generally don't do this, but I asked for the manager first thing. I mean, from the way the hostess treated us to the ridiculous wait for a waiter... *sigh* The manager seems like a nice guy, but I don't think he's well-respected by his staff. Nothing much changed.

Anyway...enough of that. Now about the food. I have to give the kitchen major props. Though, I should preface this by saying we were STARVING, so I don't know how biased I am about the food...

The food is great. That pretty much sums it up. My part of eight ordered a variety of appetizers and sides as appetizers and wow. Portions are on the small side, but if you order a variety, your entire party can enjoy little bites and not ruin their appetites. From the garbage salad and tater-tots to the pigs-in-a-blanket and chicken wings...we pretty much finished everything on all these small plates. Entrees were good-sized portions, we had steaks to chicken to pasta - and everyone cleaned off their plates. No complaints...and considering we staved off our hunger with the appetizers, I think it's a good sign that the food was actually good.

Dessert was as good as I've had in any restaurant...not too sickeningly sweet, but not so bland you wondered why you even bothered, The sampler dessert plate is the way to go for a little bit of everything for a larger party, especially if not everyone is into desserts.

So, to sum up my ridiculously long rant? If you can get past the unprofessional front of the house staff and you don't go during a major trade show where there are a ton of people around...then I recommend Stack.

Stack! EVERYTHING was beyond great! Our waiter Vince was the BEST!! And so was his assistant Rob. What a beautiful setting with warm African mahogany, candlelight, and an exciting vibe of hip yet elegant. We started off with the Hamachi sashimi, a wonderful taste of Hamachi and very thinly sliced jalapeno with ponzu. We had a sliced ribeye that came with two really good sauces. I wish I knew the recipe for the one lighter in color as it was amazing! I haven't even mentioned the SEA BASS WITH LOBSTER RISOTTO TO DIE FOR!!! Summa dat! And the parmesan truffle fries with yet ANOTHER yummy dipping sauce! Oh yeah, and the yummy side of mushrooms...We were happily in a food coma the rest of the night. I almost forgot to mention the Ketel One Martinis with Point Reyes blue-cheese stuffed huge Queen olives. Three each. Olives, silly, not martinis! To sum it up, at the end of the meal, my husband said it was one of the top 10 meals he's ever had. I agree.

Ted THE BEST BARTENDER in VEGAS, we got screwed on the prix fix menu and reservations for New Years.  mgr compd drinks, waited for food, total bummer, food was 3/5...ted6/5, mgmt 0/5, organization 0/5.

Since it was D's Bachelorette Weekend, we had reservations to dine here since they had a Bachelorette package.  Here's what the package included:
*Champagne Toast
*4 tapa-style appetizers: Hot Rocks, Pigs in a Blanket, Lobster Tacos, Miso Black Cod Lettuce Wraps.
*A choice of 3 Entrees: Filet, Organic Chicken, or Penne Pasta
*3 sides: Crunchy Steak House Fries, Whipped Potatoes, Sauteed Spinach
*3 desserts: Banana Brownie "Bon Bons", Warm Chocolate Cake, Jelly Doughnut "Munchkin" Holes.

The Food:
*Champagne - Tasted like cheap $5 Cook's champagne
*Hot Rocks - the raw meat ( a bit on the salty side) was really tender and tasted pretty good after leaving them on the hot rocks. Remember to drink some water with this dish.
*Pigs in a Blanket - they were pretty much the baby hotdogs and there wasn't anything so special about this appetizer. 
*Lobster Tacos - I didn't taste any mango on this, but it was just OK
*Miso Black Cod Lettuce Wraps - TOO much sauce for a small lettuce cup.
*Organic Chicken - I personally didn't like this at all. Granted it was juicy and lean, it didn't taste "well done".  Due to the dim lights in the restaurant, I wasn't even able to check if it was pink at all.  The string beans weren't cooked all the way and could have used a TRIM on the ends.
*Petite Filet - I didn't try this but the girls said it was pretty good.
*I tried a little bit of the Penne Pasta - This was definitely a winner! Parmesan, proscuitto and black truffle definitely complimented this dish. 
*Sauteed Spinach (side dish): Only ate this because it was in front of me.  VERY salty and overcooked. Yuck.
*Only tried the Jelly Doughnuts out of all the desserts. It was VERY sweet and not that bad.

PROS:
*Nice server
*Nice ambiance
*C's Penne Pasta

CONS:
*Horrible Service by taking a LONG TIME - Took over 1 hour for our food to come out and we were rushed to eat fast to leave so we can make it on time for clubbing. 
*Smelly cup of water and lack of refilling your water 
*Food - The food was nasty. No presentation.  My left over chicken had better presentation.  
*Overpriced - Wow... For the package that includes bad service and stinky water, each girl paid $81 (also to cover bachelorette + tax + gratuity). 

I was so dehydrated and there was no more water on my cup.  It was really hard to flag someone down unless you walk up to them. The service was slower than the traffic on Las Vegas Blvd.

Shared the 40 OZ. Dry Aged  porter house along with a butter poached lobster tail.
Service was top notch.  We'll be back in Feb. and we're for sure coming back for dinner.

My favorite place for steak in Las Vegas. That is a big statement and every time I visit Stack I don't change my mind. (I would give 6 stars if they had the Kobe special every day). The rating is for the food and decor (which to me feels like the inside of a beehive). The wait staff on the other hand is just average. Typical Las Vegas attitudes. But I do need them to bring me my amazing food from the kitchen. ;)

The steaks are great, cooked to perfection everytime. I also love their unique selection of appetizers from Chicken Parm Sticks to Hot Stone beef. Fun and tasty stuff for everyone.

Came here for dinner and we had the Hot Rocks, NYC Sirloin and Seabass. The hot rock was thinly sliced sirloin cooked on a sizzling hot rock which was an interesting experience since it was my first time trying it. The sirloin steak wasn't bad with their peppercorn sauce. Seabass was also alright, a bit too fishy tasting for me but the others in my group seemed to like it. The lighting was really dark during dinner so it's a perfect date night type of place.

Had reservations for 8:00 and was sat down immediately at a nice round table - we were visiting and wanted a nice steak dinner. 

I ordered a 8oz filet and ordered it medium and it came out medium rare (still bleeding) so I sent it back to be cooked more to medium and it came back looking the same exact way - still bleeding :( I ended up not eating it at all because who wants to send a dish back twice at that point I rather eat a Big Mac.... My lobster risotto was good !

Next  another person in our group ordered short ribs with a balsamic glaze(this was terrible ) the glaze was more of a thick heavy coating and was hard to cut into he and his wife shared a wedge salad and after they ate the salad they both said their stomachs were upset. After our meal the both had to use the bathroom facilities twice before we even got our check! 

Another guest got the kale salad with lobster on the side and as we were walking down the strip she had to run to the bathroom, currently her husband just left his drink and ran to the bathroom himself 

I think it's safe to say 4 of the 7 guests are currently experiencing major stomach issues
